Reviews.Title: “Great B&B”
Reviews.Author: Annette L
Reviews.Content: Our second time visiting Rome, first was for a Wedding so we didnt see much, great city for sight seeing but over all experience with the people and services was appalling, so rude and unpleasant, services were terrible also, no public toliets anywhere, with the exception of the main metro (self-service) it was very efficient. I suppose they dont see the need to be polite as they get thousands of tourists that will keep on visiting. It would not be a city I would recommend visiting. Our hosts at Hotel Maikol were excellent, English was pretty good and they were more than helpful & friendly, rooms and bathrooms were spotless everyday. Location was pretty central, metro was practically outside the door, so it was a great base for getting around. I would recommend this B&B without doubt, helpful & pleasant people along with the sites was the only two positive things on the entire trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money budget stay”
Reviews.Author: Kazza1283
Reviews.Content: We booked the Maikol hotel after searching for a cheap but reasonable hotel in Rome. We found the hotel easily after a short walk from the termini. No more than ten minutes and contrary to other reviews we found it easy to find using descriptions given by others. We were greeted by the owner of the hotel who apologised our room wasn't ready even though we were very early and hadn't expected it to be. She was extremely helpful in explaining how to get where we needed to be and this continued throughout the trip. The room we were given had a great view of the piazza, was very large and spotlessly clean with comfy beds... Something inhave found to be hit and miss during other european trips.We were served breakfast each morning at a time of our choice which was lovely and plentiful. A great way to start the day. They even delivered a packed breakfast of croissants to our room on our morning of departure as we had to leave at 7am. The hotel is well placed for the colosseum - a brisk 10minute walk and also for accessing the rest of Rome including the Vatican city which can be accessed via the metro from right outside the hotel. About 15minutes journey. Other reviews have commented on the area. Although it is a less salubrious area if Rome we never felt threatened and food nd drink was generally cheaper than in other areas. Overall a great choice if you want a clean, comfortable and great value stay in Rome with fantastic service. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Marielisediane
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay,very affordable,clean and close to the train station and the metro. It's in a neighborhood out of the touristic area which I found interesting. My niece (17 years old) did not. The walks are long to the touristic area. If you love to walk and brouse around; it's great. You get to see how people live. When you're tired you come back by bus or metro. It's easy to get around. The people that welcomed us were sweet and remembered our name. The breakfast served in our room was good,as was the coffee. We had a view on the park accross the street. If your budget is a bit tight go there. You will have a lot for your money!

Reviews.Title: “Large Rooms, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: danielyeews
Reviews.Content: Stayed as a family in December 2011 for 3 nights. Excellent Service, the staff was really helpful and waited up for us as we were arriving in Rome rather late in the evening. The breakfast served to your room was really good and convenient; a great way to start the day. They were also helpful in helping us to plan our trips to the various attractions in the city, both with maps and advice. The rooms are really big, with more than enough space to put your luggage and relax. We were allocated rooms just across the hallway from each other, which was convenient. Feels very homely, so as long as you don't expect your typical detached hotel experience, it is certainly a good deal. Our only gripe was with finding the hotel, as our taxi driver was confused as to the location at first. Then it took a while to find it, because there is only a small sign next to the door, which is located in the middle of a shopping area. The elevator up is located past yet another door on the right after your initial entry.

Reviews.Title: “Modest but spotless hotel in central Rome”
Reviews.Author: texandi
Reviews.Content: Maikol is a small hotel about a ten minute walk from Termini train station. It is very modest, but our room was large and comfortable, and everything was squeaky clean. It also included a very nice breakfast delivered to our room. The owners are just great, so anxious to be helpful and welcoming. A very nice find, especially in Rome which is always a hard place to find decent hotels at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel Close to Termini”
Reviews.Author: elfamin
Reviews.Content: 10 minute walk from Termini, but can be difficult to find. We walked right past it because there are no signs saying "Hotel Maikol" out front. When we got there, there was no electricity in the whole building because of city construction, but we were assured it would be restored by night -- not a problem b/c we were going sightseeing anyway (who spends any time in the hotel during the day in Rome???). Sure enough, power was back up when we returned after dinner. Management was VERY apologetic for the situation -- we understood -- it wasn't their fault. At 80E/night, it's a steal, esp if you're traveling to/from Termini station -- it's a 10 min walk. The area can appear a bit seedy at night, but we always felt safe. Breakfast (croissants, coffee, tea, juice, etc.) is brought to your room in the morning at the time you request. Great value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Second time staying-still awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: LoriO24
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at Maikol and it was just as awesome as the first time. When I found out I would be returning to Rome I immediately booked this place for 3 nights, two rooms. The rooms are large and clean. The staff are the nicest people I have met in all my travels. They make sure you are comfortable and give great directions and dinner ideas. I can't say enough about how great these people are. The hotel comes with breakfast in the room, delivered at the time of your choosing. You can not ask for a better value. The place is tough to find, but like other reviews said just look for the MAS sign. The best thing to do if arriving by train is to walk down to the far train platforms near where the Leonardo Express is, bin 24 I think it is. Exit there and it is a straight shot to the hotel, only a 10 minute walk...easy with luggage. There is a metro stop right at the hotel as well. Most sights are in walking range. I stayed with my older parents(first time in Europe for them) and they loved it. You can't go wrong with this place for value, location and cleanliness. I love it and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Crystal S
Reviews.Content: My sister and I (aged 23 and 20 respectively) stayed at this hotel for 6 nights in February. The staff was very nice and warm, and very helpful with suggestions to best navigate your way through the city. The room was very clean (my sister is a clean freak and immediately inspected the room when we arrived) and surprisingly large. The hotl is located in what appears to be Chinatown, and the area around it was kind of sketchy, but there are three doors to get through before you're in the hotel, which is very reassuring. The metro is literally at the end of the block heading to Termini, which is only a 5 minute walk from the hotel. As well, a few streets over, on one of the main streets right in front of Termini, there is the most AMAZING restaurant named Hosteria Pizzeria. If you get the chance, make sure you head there for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AdvoKitty
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights in February. The staff were friendly and helpful and the rooms were reasonably clean and spacious. The area that the hotel is located in is reasonably run down but we had no problems during our stay and the location is great for the metro, train station and sights. Each day they ask you what time you would like your breakfast and what you would like to drink with your breakfast the next morning as they serve it in your room. The food for breakfast is the same each morning: Italian croissants and french toast biscuits with jam, butter or nutella, I'd recommend the lovely sweet croissants! The en-suite bathroom was good, we had no problems with the shower heat or pressure consistency, although the soap holder had probably seen better days. The only downsides we had was that the person that lived above us (we were in room 9) would get up about an hour before we did and it sounded like they dragged their chair along the floor which was really loud in our room so often woke us up before we were ready to get up, although this wouldn't be a problem if you normally wake up before 7am and we don't think that is within the hotel's control. Also the hairdryer did not have a permanent on switch (presumably to save electricity as there were only 3 plug sockets in our room as well) so my hand often got cramp whilst drying my hair, but again not a problem if you don't intend to use the hairdryer! The bed was definitely on the firm side, so probably alright if you sleep on your back, and the pillows were fairly thin but overall we enjoyed our stay even if we were a little tired.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great staff”
Reviews.Author: mattuella
Reviews.Content: If you're on a budget, this is your hotel in Rome! Breakfast served in the room, cozy atmosphere, very nice staff. 1 minute walk from metro station - restaurants and shops around. Really unexpensive for the comfort and location.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden little gem!”
Reviews.Author: Adam T
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend picked out this hotel for my 30th birthday trip last year. Picked it blind as she had no idea where to stay. Turned out to be an inspired choice! Staff are very friendly, room was very clean and breakfast was brought into our room each morning whenever you wanted it. Make sure you ask for an en-suite because I don't think all rooms have a bathroom attached. Lovely little place, great location - we walked everywhere - Colosseum was 10 minutes away on foot and the main station where the airport buses stop is again only 10 minutes on foot. Only problem - it took us a while to find it - no signage! That's a tiny tiny detail, it really is a lovely little place. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: GiorgosKon K
Reviews.Content: The hotel and its staff are very good.The breakfast is excellent Room was big and clean with nice view to a park. Metro station is in 30 metres. The surrounding area is full of asia shops but there isnt sth to be afraid of. The hotel is a "value for money" place that i will definitely stay again. Bravo hotel Maikol!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and great staff”
Reviews.Author: NewTravellers5962
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to the Termini Train Station (about a 10-15 minute walk) and can be a little difficult to find. Look on Google Street view and you can see the hotel door (right next to the MAS department store). The rooms are plain but is perfect for exploring Rome. The staff are very friendly and helpful and there is free WiFi in the rooms. The breakfast is more than adequate and was delivered on time as requested. Will stay there again when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: hak63
Reviews.Content: It is about a 15 minute walk from the Termini train station. Without other Trip Advisor posts we would have had a hard time finding the hotel. There is a large wooden door right next to the MAS store. Go up a few flights of stairs and you are there. The room was large, bed comfortable and breakfast was adequate and waiting for us at the time we requested every morning. The staff were very nice. Hotel is located no more than a 10 minute walk to the Colosseum. We were very comfortable walking around this area at night and there are a fair number of restaurants within a few blocks of the hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel. We went in March 2011 and got a really great price.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravellers099
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in September for several nights. The rooms are very plain with very little decoration; however, we were there to visit Rome so it was exactly what we needed. We walked to most places from the hotel and it was located very close to the metro train system. The breakfast delivered to the room each morning was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: N S
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and comfortable and a great value for the price. Each morning, we had a breakfast of fresh pastries/croissants, orange juice, cappuccinos or tea. They even provided us with an early breakfast at our request. I liked the location -- walking distance from many of the city's tourist sites, including the Coloseo, as well as the train station (and conveniently located right above a metro station line that will take you to many major sites, including the Vatican). The hotel proprietors were friendly and welcoming. I would certainly recommend staying here, if you are not looking for a super fancy accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed 13 nights too long”
Reviews.Author: bdwood2000
Reviews.Content: Check in 02/28/2011, 14 nights The hotel is located near the main train station, a 10-15 walk. The metro line is close as well. The young women, daughter-in-law of the owner, was the bright spot in the service. These are the pluses. The place was not very well run. We there in the winter, the heat was not always on, as the owner of the building turns it off during the night. The breakfasts, served in the room were a quality lower than airplane food. The air quality is not good in Rome, even worse in the hotel. They were constantly spraying air freshner to hide whatever was being smoked by the staff and family. This is not a place we would go back to. It was a bargain, but sometimes you get what you pay for, or less. This was one of those times.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: banzai0
Reviews.Content: We stayed only for one night due to a sudden flight rebooking. The hotel is about a ten minute walk from Roma Termini and is a few steps away from the Vittorio Emmanuel metro station. It is a very convenient place to base yourself to visit the different sites around Rome either by walking or taking the metro. Unfortunately, the day we checked in, there was a metro/bus strike. As previously mentioned, just look for the MAS store and the hotel is located just beside it. The tiny hotel signage on the wall is easy to miss so it is better to just look for the huge MAS sign. The room was basic but adequate for our needs. The important thing was that it was clean and functioning. Unless you understand Italian, the TV is pretty much useless since there is not much else to watch. Some complained about the towels which were like cloth, but it did not really bother me at all. Wifi is free as it comes with the room rate. Just ask for the password to be able to connect. Since we were leaving early in the morning, our breakfast was prepared and served to our room the night before so that we had something to eat before we departed Rome. This gesture was very much appreciated by us. Another thing, we were given four sets of keys so that we can enter and leave the hotel anytime we wanted to. Otherwise, we had to buzz the hotel twice in order to get in. One key was for the main door to get into the compound, the second was to get in the building, the third is to get inside the hotel, and the fourth is obviously for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: JAK85
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Clean room. Good breakfast. Very helpfull and nice staff. Always smiling. :) Will definetly stay there again. Can be difficult to locate from the street. It's only a very small sign next to the door.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: figment7
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed at the Hotel Maikol and the staff was very welcoming throughout the stay and was always available to answers any questions about Rome. The only negative thing I can say is that if I hadn't read the other reviews on how to find this place I would have walked right by so read others big thing to note is next door to MAS (department store). The staff was great and even created a breakfast for the morning of our departure since we left at 5am. Each morning you get a selection of yogurts, pastries and bread along with OJ, coffee, or cappuccino. Overall staff was excellent, this a B&B not the Ritz but has everything you need!

Reviews.Title: “easy, fast, close to termini”
Reviews.Author: LoveToConnect
Reviews.Content: we stayed one night at Maikol and it was a nice experience. easy check-in, the room was huge, albeit plainly decorated, the bed was the usual italian firm (envision: marble slab :-) ) however we didn't experience any better when staying at a nicer hotel. the owner offered breakfast in our room, however we had to leave at 7am. by 7:10 we couldn't wait any longer, so sadly missed the breakfast. it was a nice gesture nonetheless. the neighborhood has a lot of culture - a great way to see another side of rome away from the tourists. and only 5 min to reach termini. recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and comfortable too!”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravelqq111
Reviews.Content: We stayed in March and hed a great stay. The location is excellent, close to the train but far enought away that you feel that you aren't in the midst of a tourist throng. You can walk everywhere, a gorgeous walk stright down to the coliseum through a beautiful park, but if you are tired it is on the metro/bus route...re: finding it, look for the store MAS, it has a huge sign and the entrance door and buzzer is almost right beside it...the rooms are very comfortable, basic but modern, spacious and clean, the bed was very comfortable. The staff is very helpful amd Fiorella made the absolute best breakfast!!! i prepared my friend for the "tourist continental", crummy brioche, a cappucino machine, etc. but we were given a silver tray with premium qualty espresso, whipped milk, fresh absolutely delicious pastries..when we moved on to Venice we almost cried in the mornging because our little breakfast was gone! my only tip is if you don't like noise ask for aroom in the back because the rooms facing the street are nosier. There is a great bakery around the corner with amazing pastires, also the MAS store is full of cheap clothing deals..we were there in march and it was pretty cold so I stocked up on a few sweaters. Great hotel for the price!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great B&B, okay location”
Reviews.Author: CalH87
Reviews.Content: This was the first time that I have ever stayed in a B&B and it was great!! The Hotel Maikol provided us with a great place to base ourselved during our 3 nights stay in Rome. The staff were all very friendly and eager to help us with whatever we needed. The rooms very spacious and quiet as well which was nice. There was a TV with cable, but most channels were in Italian so we didn't use it very much. The shower was tiny but from other hotels I have stayed in within Rome, this seems standard. Breakfast was delivered to our door every morning at whatever time we wanted and consisted of ham and cheese toasties, croissants, yogurt, orange juice and coffee/hot chocolate which was fantastic!! Unfortunately the WiFi wouldn't work on my laptop which was disappointing but I was able to use their computer when I need to book something which was helpful. The hotel is only 100m to the metro station and 10 minutes to the Colosseum which was helpful. The area itself is okay, but better during the day than the night. We thought it was good value for money considering the breakfast was free and it was close to the metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Mini Break in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ajd83
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Maikol for 3 nights recently! We were very impressed and couldn't recommend it highly enough. Really great value for money. Easy walk to most attractions (we only caught the metro to the Vatican). Our room over looked the piazza which was really pretty both day & night. Spotlessly clean in every way. Adequate breakfast which was always on time. Betty was so accommodating to our needs, providing a bed for our baby etc. As previous reviews have mentioned, it's not very difficult to find even though there isn't a large sign saying the hotel name. Just look for the number (138) and buzz in at the large wooden doors. We will definitely stay here again when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Convenient, Family B&B”
Reviews.Author: samplin
Reviews.Content: This little B&B has cleaniness and customer service including free wi-fi to recommend it. My husband and I stayed there three nights last week. We slept like rocks each night. The day we arrived was my husband's birthday. Fiora advised us of a nice place for lunch. In the evening Betty and all the family brought my husband a cake complete with candles denoting his age, and a bottle of wine. They even sang "happy birthday." The location is marred by a lot of sidewalk merchants, but it is so convenient - thirty yards to the Metro which we used every day; walking distance to Statione Termini from which we arrived from Civitivecchi and departed to Fumincino - 11 to 15 euro by taxi; two blocks from Santa Maria Maggiore. There are many little food shops and a supermarket nearby and a fridge in the room. Sunday, when we'd eaten a large meal in early afternoon, we picked up somehing light to put in the fridge for an evening snack. Breakfast was served in the room. The panini and cappuchio were great. Betty even fixed it an hour early for us the morning we left and called the taxi for us. The shower was hot and our needs were met. Warning, there is a lot of marble getting into the place and it is a bit slick. There are about 8-10 to ten steps going down to the desk from the elevator. Disappointment: the price had risen to 115 euro per night from the time we'd booked in March.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, affordable and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: cathy c
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 2 week vacation in Italy where we started in Rome and stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. The hotel is hard to find unless you know what you are looking for. We followed the directions written in other reviews below and had no trouble. Our room was very clean and the service was great. The owner let us drop off our bags early in the morning before our room was ready. This is a perfect hotel if you need a clean, affordable place close to the train station to crash after a long day of sightseeing in Rome. The owner is as nice as can be and delivers the continental breakfast, including coffee and juice, to your room. She is very accommodating as to the time she brings the breakfast. One word of advice, bring your own bar of soap and shampoo/conditioner. The hotel bar soap is very small.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: skymo99
Reviews.Content: My Husband made two reservations for two rooms- just for one night- we were passing back thru from Capri. The Hotel assumed we had doubled book our rooms, so they dropped one reservation. Even though we had written confirmation on two rooms. It was 6pm and our flight was at 8am the next morning- They had no rooms for our friends. We went back and forth with the lady at the front desk- who was NO HELP- but just kept saying sorry and taking no BLAME for the dropping of the reservation. She did find up another Hotel-Oh no!!! it was not a HOTEL- it was a HOSTEL. Bad Business!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this place.”
Reviews.Author: hillbilly60
Reviews.Content: I read the great reviews and booked this place looking forward to our stay. The four of us spent a long day traveling to get to rome, took a taxi to hotel maikol, The the cab driver had no idea were it was and if I had not google earthed it we would be wandering around this seedy neighborhood. Anyway, when we arrived I was told that even though I had the printed out reservations, they had no rooms! They screwed up our reservation!!! We ended up at a hostel in the same seedy neighborhood. And don't let anyone tell you this is a nice area.

Reviews.Title: “Kentish Folk”
Reviews.Author: Lynn S
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 day city break to Rome and stayed at this Hotel. We chose this hotel after reading the reviews of other guests and we weren’t disappointed. Friendly and helpful staff, very clean hotel, great price with 'substantial' continental breakfast. Great location for sightseeing, not far from Termini the main railway station and the Metro station Vittorio Emmanuelle is only a five minute walk away. We highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodations”
Reviews.Author: jack76
Reviews.Content: The hotel is approx. 4 blocks from the main train station and directly accross from the Vittorio Emanuelle Park. The walk was 5-10 minutes and thanks to photos on Trip Advisor, was easy to locate next to the MAS department store. The room was fairly large by Italian standards and extremely clean. Each room offers flat screen TV, refrigerator, hair dryer and remote control air conditioning unit. The hostess, Betty, was extremely friendly and helpful. She provided maps and directions for various attractions and suggestions for tourist friendly restaurants. Each morning at the time of your choosing she delivered a wonderful continental breakfast with various coffees, juice, pastries and yogurt. At check out you can pay either with cash or Visa/Mastercard but the 2 Euro per person per night city tax must be paid in cash so be sure to save some of your Euros for that. All in all we highly recommend the Hotel Maikol and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Cosmo45
Reviews.Content: I'm rating the Hotel Maikol 5 star, not because it's a "5 star" hotel, but because it's a "5 star" experience in a 2 star hotel. The room is a nice size, is clean, and has a small refrigerator. The shower was small, but then all of the shower stalls we saw in Italy were small! The breakfast provided was excellent (2 of us got 2 hot ham and cheese sandwiches, 2 danish rolls, 2 yogurts, and a 4 to 6 cup pot of great coffee - at least a 20 Euro value!). Previous reviews have done a great job of describing the location - the MAS description is right on. To go a little further, it's an easy 5 to 8 minute walk from the exit at the #28 platform at the termi station, the platform used for the FCO airport express train (if you come in on a different train, follow the signs to #28 and exit there). When you exit, walk down the street that's straight ahead (Radison Hotel will be 1st building on your left) for 3 blocks where it ends at the west side of Piazza V. Emanuele II. Look to your right and you'll see 2 buildings on the north side of the Piazza - Hotel Maikol is located toward the end of the 2nd building, just past the large MAS sign. Betty is great, and will let you leave your suitcases there if you arrive before their 2 p.m. check-in (we did, and our suitcases were in our room when we returned. The Metro station is really convenient to the hotel - just between those 2 buildings on the north side of the Piazza. We walked abound the area after 10 p.m. and had no uneasy feelings about the surroundings, so I'd say the area felt safe to us. We will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Andiamo88
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at Hotel Maikol while on our way through Italy. The location is great - a short walk from the main train station (Staz. Termini) in Rome. The sign is hard to spot, so be sure you have the address so you can find the exact number. The staff were very friendly and kind to us. The bathroom was nice and the air conditioning felt great. Our room faced the back and was very quiet, which was nice after flying so long.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: alan h
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights and would return again anytime . You are a few minutes from the main train station with metro and bus services just outside the door . The room and en suite were spotless with fresh towels each day and the air con was a blessing in the middle of a Rome heatwave . We ate breakfast each day watching the stalls on the square below come to life and the crazy Rome traffic weave around one another . Betty ( who runs the hotel ) was lovely , very helpful and made us feel very welcome .

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: peter_bklyn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from September 7 - 9, 2001. Overall we had a great experience staying there and would definitely stay there again without hesitation. Getting there: We took a train into Rome that arrived at Termini station. Getting to the hotel from there is very easy. It's only a short 10 minute walk. Just make sure you get out on the right side of Termini station. If you look on google maps you can see where you should go. As others have pointed out, finding the actual hotel is a bit of a mystery but following the excellent advice posted here it is easy. Just look for the MAS sign and there are two large wooden doors next to it. You'll see Hotel Maikol on the intercom list. Just press that and you're good to go. Once you go through the wooden doors there is another metal door immediately to your right where you will need to use the intercom again. Then use the elevator to the second floor and you'll see the hotel. Location: The hotel is right outside a station on the metro A line and a few minutes from the main transportation hub (Termini). Getting to any of the tourist destinations is very easy as most are situated within walking distance of a stop on the metro lines. You will likely have to take the metro though - we did not feel that most attractions were within walking distance. The Colosseum is probably the closest and would be about 15 min but it was easier to just take the train rather than try and navigate through the streets. We had to take a flight back out of Ciampino airport and there is a bus that leaves just outside Termini station every couple hours or so. We took the cotral bus which isn't heavily advertised but it is on time, far less crowded than the other bus services to the airport and easy to get to. There is a stand outside the station where you wait and you buy the tickets from the driver. It costs 3.90 euros each. Some people have mentioned the area is a bit sketchy / feeling unsafe. We felt none of that at all. We got in fairly late on a couple days (after dark) and didn't feel unsafe at all. There are a lot of immigrants in the area, but we had no problems. The room: We had a room overlooking the piazza and it was very nice as your get lots of sunlight streaming through. There are shutters for the evening if you don't want the light. The room itself is also very spacious. There is a wardrobe to hang your items and a shelf within that as well. A large desk with the mini-fridge under it is also present as well as two nightstand tables. There isn't an alarm clock (or any clock) in the room so you'll have to have your own. The room is tiled and was very clean. We had two double beds pushed together. The bed and pillows were fairly firm (we prefer that). There is a wall safe in the room that is key operated. So you'll have to take the key with you when you go out if you want to use it. The hotel itself was also very quiet - I think there are only about 10 rooms so we didn't hear any sort of noise in the morning or evening. The bathroom: The bathroom was fairly large and has a shower stall, toilet, sink and bedet. The stall is a little small but big enough for one person to manage. The shower pressure and temperature control are excellent. In terms of toiletries, you get a bar hand soap and liquid shower gels. There is no shampoo/conditioner so bring your own. The towels are mostly cloth-like as others have mentioned but that didn't bother us. Breakfast: The breakfast consists of a glass of orange juice, a beverage of your choice (tea, coffee, milk or cappuccino), a pastry (usually a croissant), a cup of yogurt (usually strawberry flavor), as well as any necessary condiments (jam, butter, etc.). For two of us, we each got the items above (so 2 of each item). Note: usually the front desk asks what time you want breakfast (within 8am - 10am) and what beverage you want when you check-in. You should specify if they don't ask. Also, the milk by default comes hot so if you want it cold you should specify that. Service: The room was cleaned nicely each day and since the facility is owner operated you feel very welcomed and get personal service. The owner lady is very nice and will show you where everything is on the map when you get in and explain how to get there. You do have to carry around the 4 keys for each of the doors to get into the hotel but that didn't bother us. We also got in a day late due to a transit strike in Rome on the day we were supposed to get in and we called the hotel ahead of time to alert them. They acknowledged and said they would work it out when we got in. Upon check-in they agreed not to charge us for the night we weren't there even though they left the room empty. We thought that was really nice of them.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for a city break!”
Reviews.Author: blueesmrs
Reviews.Content: Perfect spot for a weelend break, room was large looking out onto the square to see the hssle & bussle of the city but not noisy. Breakfasts were great & location was perfect easy to go to the central train station & jump on a city bus to see all the sites. Very secure Would recommend in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value. Just wish the internet connection was better”
Reviews.Author: Anon773
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week with my boyfriend. Room was very big and clean, but shower was small (which is typical). Staff was very helpful and breakfast was great. Area isn't the very best, but it's safe and centrally located. I walked around past midnight and never felt in danger. Only real negative was the the internet was painfully and frustratingly slow, which meant looking something up could take forever whether it's looking up reviews for things to do or googling directions. Sucks to have to go to the lobby after a long a day to look up weather, what to do the next day, etc. instead of being able to do it in the comfort of your own room. Normally this wouldn't be an issue, but I'm heavily reliable on the internet when planning my travels.

Reviews.Title: “hospitality, clean, roomy & nice”
Reviews.Author: Julie G
Reviews.Content: We were in room 6 with the big mural. I've stayed in hotels in many big cities, and this was GIANT compared to New York City. The staff, Fiora and Patchi (spelling?), were gracious and never intrusive. We always felt like we had someone we could ask for help and recommendations. Having their help made an enormous difference when in a country where neither of us spoke the language. They were wonderful! The view of the park was lovely, the breakfast was good by European standards (pastry, juice & coffee) and always timely. The room was immaculately clean, and the small refrigerator made it very convenient to buy some items and plan picnics. Be sure to try out the gelataria around the corner (pistachio will blow you away). We went every day! Anywhere in Europe creature comforts arent at American expectations, but we anticipated that and were very comfortable. Subway stop right around the corner & Termini is easy walking distance for many trains and buses.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely recommendable!”
Reviews.Author: TravellingBarefooted
Reviews.Content: Don't expect this to be a five-star level hotel-this is a plain bed and breakfast hotel but you could mistake it as one! What made this a winner for me are: 1. LOCATION. The hotel is strategically located centrally: walking distance from nearest Metro station (just 30 meters) and the Colloseum! 2. SERVICE: The hotel is family-owned, and so the service is extremely warm. They do not use uniforms at work but damn! Who cares?:) They always make sure everything is fine and working. The room and bath are always clean and they serve breakfast at the exact time you requested. They greeted us everytime we met them at the alley. And well, tip is good but they refused it. They respect money too! Think of service man!:) 3. PRICE. We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights for a really good price. And take note, breakfast was included. And take note again, really heavy breakfast. Well, I think that was a good buy. 4. ROOM. The room is really spacious (at least our room). Airconditioned, with refrigerator, comfortable beds, flat screen TV and hot/cold showers. For a traveller like me who loves to roam around but with a not-so-so budget, this hotel is for you.:)

Reviews.Title: “Great helpful staff, Breakfast was the highlight.”
Reviews.Author: Fire-Fly87
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be OK. The location was great, walking distance to the sights and to Termini station. The decor is super lame. Very Kistch. But I do have to say that the hotel staff was wonderful. They helped my friend when her passport was lost, and they made sure they got my cell phone charger back to me when I accidentally left it there after departing from Rome. The breakfast was definitely the highlight. Plates of sweet pastries, yogurt, fruit, orange juice and cappuccino! I loved having it delivered in the morning. They wheeled it in on a cart at the exact time we asked for it.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: genkigrl76
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights recently. The hotel was ok...very basic. On the bright side, the rooms are large and always clean, and the breakfast is good. For the amount of money we paid I thought the decor was really dated and was disappointed with no English channels on TV...( I know its Rome, but just one channel would have been sooo nice). The area is definitely not great, but I always felt safe. I was not a fan of Rome mostly because of the people. I had many negative experiences with people being really rude. This area, however has a ot of immigrants and they were always very helpful and friendly...in contrast to the Romans. The proximity to the train station is also a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: KenShapiro
Reviews.Content: The staff are amazing and will bend over backwards to help you. The rooms are nice and air-conditioned. We loved how close this is to the train and the center of town. We easily walked everywhere. You do not need a taxi to get here as it is a short 5 minute walk from the train. It was hard to find, we once you do, it is very easy to get to. We came in very late and they stayed up to check us in. Every morning we had a contenential breakfast in our room. when we left at 5:30am, they prepare a bag breakfast for us the night before. Go to Restaurante Leonetti for dinner one night, it was a short walk and a real treat.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel! Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: habibah1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a total of 4 nights. We traveled to Venice in between our stay here in Rome. The owner/staff are so helpful and delightful! We were brought breakfast to our rooms every morning-- fresh and delicious! The rooms were simple but definitely did the trick. The wifi was a little spotty in the rooms but great in the lobby. Felt very safe and secure. We walked EVERYWHERE in Rome and the location was great. We got the Roma pass so we had access to the metro which was right near the hotel. Very easy to navigate around! We had taken the metro from the airport and the location of the hotel was easily walkable to the Roma Temini (main Rome train station)- maybe 8 minutes. We took the train to Venice so the location couldn't have been better. All in all, would definitely recommend to the budget traveler. Simple but great people-- that's what made it so enjoyable. And of course the cheaper price!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely good deal”
Reviews.Author: OurFuture
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an extremely clean, comfortable, and large (but not charming) room for a good price, Hotel Maikol is for you. The staff is very helpful; the delivered-to-your-room breakfast is delicious; everything is fairly new. We stayed 5 nights and loved it. Note that through 2011 construction closes the Metro around 9pm Sunday through Thursday, which means you have to plan when and how you will get back to the hotel at night from more distant parts of the city. Other commenters have done a great job explaining how to find the street entrance--read those before coming.

Reviews.Title: “What you expect from the reviews is what you get”
Reviews.Author: mandeeqld
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a five star luxury hotel - look elsewhere. This hotel is exactly what it is described as: A reasonably priced, clean, comfortable, three star hotel close to Termini station. If you follow the instructions from previous reviewers on this site you should have no difficulty finding the hotel. The check-in and check-out times are strictly adhered to but you can leave luggage if you are early or have a late departure. The area is not the best but I had no security issues during my stay. There are several restaurants in the vicinity of the hotel for lunch and dinner. Breakfast is included and was delivered punctually at the requested time. The staff were friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “conveniently located, excellent value and friendly reception”
Reviews.Author: tourismento
Reviews.Content: I spent almost an entire week at Hotel Maikol. It is located within walking distance from the Roma Termini (Rome's main railway station), and is located right above the a metro station. Breakfast was included in the room price, so was a free high speed internet connection. Cleanliness was very good. If you have luggage with you, do note that there is a lift to bring you up to the second level where the Hotel is located. Overall, it was a positive experience and would definitely return for my next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A good option”
Reviews.Author: KatesRoy
Reviews.Content: The price, the service, and the cleanliness were great. The location is right by the metro on the Piazza Vittorio Emmanuele II square, and they bring your breakfast and morning coffee/juice to your room. The only downside was the location was a bit away from where I prefer to stay, and it took four keys to get into your room. I appreciate the security, but carrying around four keys was a bit weighty.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: drummondsrus
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 5 nights,and was very happy with the room ,service ,and the price .If i return i will stay again

Reviews.Title: “A welcome retreat”
Reviews.Author: RingetteBunny
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the triple room with our daughter and found it a welcome retreat from the noise and heat of Rome. It was quiet with sound-proofed windows, lovely air conditioning, and even a small refrigerator in the room. Beds were OK, shower had great pressure. The staff were very helpful, at any time of day or night. And you can't beat the price, 80 euro including a decent breakfast delivered to your room. And they take credit cards too! The only drawback is the location, which seems to be in Chinatown. And it's close to the train station, which is both good (walkind distance) and bad (somewhat seedy). Definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great for sleeping in!!”
Reviews.Author: holidayqueen83
Reviews.Content: This hotel is tucked away, but it is also pretty central to most things. What we loved most about this hotel was that it was quaint, hidden, and a comfortable place to sleep. Why most people complain about this place i have no idea. You go out to sightsee! I would definitely come back here next time i come back to Rome. The area is filled with Pakistani and Asian migrants but we never felt threatened or scared when out at night.

Reviews.Title: “Just as good as advertised”
Reviews.Author: tinkaminka
Reviews.Content: First of all, I don't understand why people say that the hotel area is sketchy. Everywhere in Rome (or in any other big city) after sunset gets sketchy. We never once felt threatened or intimidated in any way and we returned back to the hotel at night (around 9pm) everyday for a week. Walking in front of the Colosseum in the middle of the afternoon was far more stressful with all the sellers and tourist scammers harassing us. My husband and I found it exciting that the area around the hotel had all these small little authentic and delicious Indian, Chinese, Sri Lankan, Arabic and Italian places to eat (to name a few: "Hua Lian", "Krishna 13", "Curry Leaf catering", "Trattoria Pizzeria Vecchia Roma"). If you're traveling on a budget you would find this very useful because they are all way more cheaper than the Italian restaurants in the main areas. There's everything you could possibly need close to the hotel, including a metro stop, pharmacies, a park and a supermarket. The Colosseum and the Roman Forum are very close as well, just a short 10min walk from the hotel. Hotel Maikol was exactly what we expected based on the tripadvisor reviews. The hosts were very kind and helpful with everything we needed. The room was spotless and cleaned impeccably every day. As mentioned in previous reviews, the towels provided are essentially cloth sheets (like in many other hotels around Italy), so you should pack your own towel if you feel this would be a problem. If you get lost on your way to the hotel you should just follow the yellow MAS Oro signs which would lead you to the hotel. The big wooden door of hotel Maikol is right next to the MAS market. Use the doorbell and the kind hosts will let you right in.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel Maikol”
Reviews.Author: thinch007
Reviews.Content: Great location and hotel view of the street and park area. Betty went out of her way to give us the street view room we requested (from pictures of others guests) and always asked if there is anything she could do for us. We love her and her hotel. I felt very safe in this area and the Chinese restaurant in the area is awesome too. Betty is the best. Stay at this hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Its good value for money - but you get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: james_staley
Reviews.Content: The last two reviews have pretty much got the Hotel Maikol bang on. Quite hard to find (certainly was at night) despite being 10 mins from the Termini - look for MAS and then look for the Hotel Maikol bell next to the huge wooden doors and press the buzzer for entrance. Great friendly welcome and the room is spacious and very clean. Despite best efforts at noise suppression a roadside room will be noisy. Pack a set of earplugs and you should be ok. Breakfast was nice, fresh pastries and coffee delivered to the room at a time of your choosing. Location is great for the sights of Rome, although as mentioned by a previous reviewer it is within a largely migrant area. This wasnt really a problem and there were plenty of nice Italian restaurants in the vicinity. You should take care at night as some of the "nightwalkers" do look a little dodgy, although you are probably in no more danger than you would be in walking around any other capital city at night. Word on Rome itself - great place to see with a rich history to immerse yourself in - we had a fantastic 3 days. One piece of advice I would give is dont be convinced by tour guides that the queues for main attractions are long (trying to sway you with queue jumping tickets) without checking first. We were told that the queue for the Colloseum was 45mins when in fact it was 5 and the Vatican museum was 1hour 50 when in fact there was absolutely no queue at all and we walked straight in. The giveaway is that if there are no tour guides at the entrance then they obviously know they cant convince you there is a queue!! Hotel Maikol is well recommened as a clean base for exploring Rome at a price you will find hard to beat!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in a dodgy neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: soul_man19
Reviews.Content: When we got to Rome, our driver told us that the neighbourhood we were staying in wasn't where a lot of Italians stayed at but rather home to the many migrants you see around the city. He also advised that we shouldn't stay out too late and that when walking I was to make sure that I had my arms around my wife. This set the tone. Overall though, I think that the hotel was in a good location but not in the best of neighbourhoods, if that makes sense. When you get to the building that the hotel is in you are greeted by a massive double door and you press the buzzer for the hotel to gain access. When you check in they give you a set of keys and a run-down of which keys open what door. There is also an in-room safe and free wi-fi. The staff were friendly and very helpful. On arrival we were given a map and tips and directions of the major sites to see around Rome. They serve breakfast daily and on the day we were leaving, because we were checking out early, they made sure we had something to eat the following morning. The rooms were quiet and comfortable and very clean. Rooms are cleaned every day. We had a view of the square from our room and even though it opened out to the street, we didn't it noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: mousetownusa
Reviews.Content: This is a family-run pension, and you can really tell that the staff cares about the place and about their guests - the service is warm, attentive, and not uptight. The room was spacious and clean, and delicious pastries are brought to your room every morning. Great location - close to the center but the neighborhood isn't overrun with tourists. Overall a great experience, and at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean, friendly Bed & Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: KarMicWA
Reviews.Content: Hotel Maikol was located in the east part of Rome; there seemed to be a lot of Asian shops around us. There were lots of middle-eastern (?) street vendors right outside the front door and all along the surrounding footpaths selling all kinds of junk from shoes to carved elephants. The B&B itself was nicer than its surroundings, quiet inside, and there was a Metro station only metres away so getting to the rest of Rome was easy. You can walk to most of the major sites if you prefer. Breakfast consisted of a couple of croissants and some packaged biscuits, and coffee or tea and juice, all brought to your room as there is no dining room. It was basic but fine - a fairly typical European breakfast. If you want something more substantial, go to a more up-market and expensive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “surprised over the many good reviews”
Reviews.Author: CopenhagenPeter
Reviews.Content: I'm a little surprised at the good reviews. Because in my opinion it is quite ordinary. Here are the advantages and disadvantages: Disadvantages: It is a small B & B, and all rooms seem to belong to a floor of a large apartment. There are quite sound, so you get a good insight into what happens in other rooms. And the host is always there, both when you go out and come back. It's maybe good for some that the host detects everything, but I want some privacy. Breakfast is served in your room because there are no other places you can can eat. And furnishings are not quite ready for a breakfast. If you like coffee and sweet pastry, then it is a good breakfast. But if you want plain bread or milk products, so it is pretty bad. You have to go through a lot of doors with different keys before you arrive on the second floor so it can be somewhat cumbersome. Not always hot water and towels are not comfortable to use. Advantages: Located relatively central to Termini. The room is clean. There was no street noise in our room. Metro station nearby.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: Quiuvole
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 4 nights and we had a great experience! The staff is super friendly and the rooms are nice and clean! The breakfast was decent and included sweet pastries, toast, butter, coffee, milk, capuccino and orange juice. The hotel has an elevator that was very convenient. This place is a little hidden but if you visit Google Earth/Google Street View and put the address, you'll see what it looks-like on the outside. To make it easier on you, just look for the MAS store and it's located right next to it. The area seems pretty safe to us and we walked very late at night around the area. We actually went walking at 11pm to the Coliseum. The bathroom was super clean and had a decent size. Even though the shower was small, my partner and I manage to take showers together. (skinny fellas). The beds were a little bit on the firmer side but comforable. The rooms have double pane windows with room darkening features for those of us that hate sunlight in the morning...the room was pitch black with the exception of some light filtering through the door. The room was cleaned daily no matter what time you leave your room. The only suggestion I have is that the TV only shows Italian television but again, who wants to watch TV while visiting Rome? Mama mia!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: wrenhunter
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 days on my second trip to Rome. It's a 10 minute walk from the "side door" of Termini, but far enough away so you miss the madness. Also a good location for visiting major churches like S. Maria Maggiore and S. Prasede. As others have said, the location on P. Vittorio Emmanuale is very urban, but not unsafe. Quiet rooms (I use earplugs) despite the busy square, and relative large for Rome. Very friendly, helpful & knowledgeable staff and good value for money. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect value, perfect service”
Reviews.Author: travelinbooth
Reviews.Content: We got off a night train at 6 am. They allowed us to check in early and take a nap before our morning tour. They brought us breakfast the next morning and then allowed us to leave our bags there for the next night. they gave us great directions around town. The room was impeccably clean and comfortable with a mini fridge and large bathroom. the hotel is a 2 minute walk from the metro station and a 6 minute walk from Termini. The hosts are incredibly nice... they made our stay in Rome perfect. Don't pay more to go elsewhere. Maikol is excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Very good. Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: holub78
Reviews.Content: This hotel is unbeliavably clean. Our room was quiet and breakfast was great! About 15 mins walking to the main attractions, which is also great.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Large Room, and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: xplorerbb
Reviews.Content: Large clean rooms with a good shower. Good small breakfast brought by hostess to your room every morning. She even got up very early to give us our breakfast before we had to leave for the station. Liked the location close to Termini Station and subway but far enough away that you don't get the noise. Hosts were nice and accommodating. Only sign for the hotel is a small brass placard on a brick building. You need 3 keys to get up and into your room. FYI all rooms we stayed at in Italy had 2 twin beds pushed together to make a queen.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful central location, with excellent value rooms and wonerful, helpful, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: SteveS56
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel at short notice to spend a week in Rome with my wife during half-term. Be careful when trying to find this hotel - its not very obvious as it is on the 2nd floor above some shops and can only be spotted by a small brass plaque to the right of the door in between two shops on the South West corner of the square. Despite arriving at around 1am we received a very friendly welcome and were shown to a lovely, spotless room. It was well equipped with flat screen, free wifi etc and a very smart ensuite bathroom. We had breakfast brought to our room promptly every day, which was sufficient to keep us going to lunch with no problem. I was particularly pleased with the large amount of coffee supplied, being a caffeine addict! I would heartily recommend this hotel. The location was perfect for visiting all that Rome has to offer and all at a bargain price. Our week in Rome turned out to be one of the most pleasant holidays we have enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Find in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Dreamer1Ireland
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Maikol on a weekend trip to Rome. The owners were extreamely helpful and the rooms were very clean & spacious. They allowed us to log onto their wi-fi using our I phone by giving us their password Towels were changed daily. The hotel does not have an enterance onto the street, you enter behind a wooden door. This made us feel very safe whilst there. Our room opened over a courtyard at the back so we had very little noise in our room so we had a great nights sleep. The hotel is located near Station Termini, we walked from there on the night of our arrival in 10 mins. There are restaurants nearby, but travel to area Travestere to get the best value. Only 15 mins walk away. Breakfast is brought to your room and service is excellent. I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: LaerkeHaahr
Reviews.Content: This small B&B offers great value for money and very friendly and helpful staff. We stayed for 4 nights and really enjoyed it. The neighborhood wasn’t the best, but we never felt really unsafe even at night. The hotel offers big and clean rooms, and is located right next to a metro station. The breakfast is nice, but consists mainly of sweet bread/cakes. If you’re looking for a good and relative inexpensive place to eat nearby, go the restaurant La Forchetta at Via de San Martino ai Monti and Via Domenichino. Remember to buy the Roma pass; besides saving you money and making everything more easy, it also allows you to skip the line at e.g. colosseum.

Reviews.Title: “The only hoonest place in Rome”
Reviews.Author: coolnehu
Reviews.Content: We stayed in rome in Maikol for a night.. the owners were nice and helpful and honest. unlike other things in rome.. Staying at Maikol was one of the best expriences I had in rome. So do give it a go. Nice people.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and convenient”
Reviews.Author: BystanderLLN
Reviews.Content: Clean and tidy although basic. Friendly and helpful owner, spacious room, located in a building with lots of charm. You gotta ask a capuccino for breakfast. Well situated: 1 min walk from metro station, a few minutes from Termini train station, and about 15 minutes from the Colosseum. Neighborhood ok. Quiet in the hotel but our room had a view on the street and was (very) noisy due to the permament traffic; the only downside I found in this accomodation. Bargain for the price!

Reviews.Title: “my second stay at this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: SarahC01
Reviews.Content: for my 3rd time in rome i decided to take my parents and boyfriend to the same hotel i stayed last yr when i visited rome with a girlfriend. it really impressed them... the location is minutes of walking from the colosseum and other interesting sites... and the metro station is on the same pavement as the hotel... the area is quite safe and there are really good restaurants around.. there is also the best gelateria a couple of corners away. i would obviously recommend it and if i ever go back to rome this is the place i would choose again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: iulian_ivascu
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights in this hotel and everything was wonderful. The receptionist was very nice and gave me a lot of informations about Rome. The breakfast was fresh and good. Colosseum was very close. Better you walk than take a metro because it takes 15 minutes to this historical objectives. Thank you, Maikol Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: emmylillylou
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Maikol for 2 nights last weekend. We really enjoyed our stay - the location was perfect, literally on the doorstop of a metro stop, we walked to the Colloseum from the hotel and got the metro everywhere else. The staff were really helpful, even providing us with a recommended route to ensure that we saw everything in the city within our time scale....which was brilliant and we managed to see everything in 3 days! We bought the Roma Pass (25 euros) which saved us money...the metro pass for 3 days was 11 euros and the entrance to the colloseum alone was 18 euros, so we automatically saved with that! The breakfast was lovely and it was so nice having it brought to our room. It could have been quite hard to find the hotel, but as many other travellers pointed out, as long as you look for the MAS discount store, you'll be able to find it. Overall, we would highly recommend this hotel for a reasonable hotel in the centre of the city within easy walking distance of everything....I've already started recommending it to friends that are looking to go to Rome in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “simply the best”
Reviews.Author: annadoglover
Reviews.Content: A fantastic place to stay in the heart of Rome. Great value accomodation in a quiet area right next to the metro and 10 minute walk to the main train station. Very clean spacious twin room overlooking a park. 55 euro for a twin room with breakfast. bargain! bathroom with a shower, sink, toilet and bidet. all the famous sights in walking distance or hop on the very easy to use metro for just 1 euro per trip.we were 2 females traveling alone and we felt very safe in the area and even around the train station that the guide book said was dodgy! we did an enjoy rome walking tour which included all the main sights in just 3 hours-great for those on a short stay like us. would definately stay again.thanks donna and rome for a lovely holiday

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: smokey_toe
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel/B&B hidden in a quiet yet convenient spot in Rome (near the train station/metro). Hostess was incredibly nice, pleasant and helpful. 10/10 Room was quite big yet bathroom shower was very small (can't even bend over small). Breakfast was ok. Very sweet and sugary Italian breakfast (not to my taste), but great to have some substance before wandering the streets of Rome. My only complaint was that the hotel was quite hard to find (even with directions, a map, and google maps on my phone). Be aware that it has no signage or display on the outside, apart from a small plaque. Highly recommended. Superb friendly service, nice big room. Good price. Great location

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, convenient, close to metro. Worth a try.”
Reviews.Author: laborsia
Reviews.Content: While this hotel isn't as fancy as some, the friendliness of the staff make up for some outdated decor. We arrived early one morning from the airport after a long international flight. The staff got us straight into our room and set us up with a free breakfast to help us on our way. The hotel is right near a metro station so is very convenient for travellers. It is in a quiet spot with not too much wandering required to find the interesting sights of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: aussieaussiesoioioi
Reviews.Content: A basic but very well run, friendly and clean B&B Located near the train station and within walking distance to the Colosseum. There is a park across the road with it's own ruins. A market operates on Satudays and Sundays in the Piazza Vittorio .

Reviews.Title: “Great B&B”
Reviews.Author: P-tosh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 days during the Thanksgiving weekend. It was very comfortable, clean and close to a Metro stop, which is very convenient if you buy the Roma Pass that gives you three days of unlimited rides on the subway. It was also only a 10-15 minute walk to the Colosseum. We picked the hotel because of nice reviews on this site in the price range. The room was a decent size, the hosts were very helpful and friendly, and the neighborhood was real Rome, away from the madness around the shopping triangle area. The hostess makes great cappuccino for breakfast, which came with fresh bakery products. We were leaving at 5 in the morning on our last day and even then they made sure we got some breakfast before we left. The downsides: Fewer places around the hotel to find dinner, but the ones that were around were reasonably priced with great food. It also had a rather small shower stall, but that seemed like a common feature in hotels there. They had free wireless Internet connection but our room was at one end of the hotel, which is basically one floor in a residential building, and we could get only a weak signal very close to the door.

Reviews.Title: “Awesomeness in the Rome madness!”
Reviews.Author: LoriO24
Reviews.Content: This B&B is really a great find in the middle of the Roman madness! It is a bit hard to find, but as others have stated just look for the MAS dept. store sign and you will find it! It is an easy walk(with luggage) from the train station and the area is safe and near a metro stop. We stayed for three nights in Dec 2010 and it was great. It is a cozy B&B, not a hotel, but the staff were super excellent. They were always pleasant and interested in our day! Breakfast is served in the room and the cappucino is the best in Italy!! They held our bags for us when we arrived early and had them in our rooms when we returned! The staff is great, the rooms are large and the bathrooms super clean. I loved it. I have stayed in Rome before at shady places so finding this place was great. We walked to the forum and col. as well as most other sites. The metro is right there are well. There is a nice park right outside and lively action throughout the evening. What makes this place so great is the staff and the great rooms. The fact that there is a mini bar with water and soda for a cheap $1 euro was a plus! Several times we had to leave early and they made sure we were fed before we left. They had a wireless internet code to use for those with laptops. All and all I loved it and will return!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, fantastic, fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: PondCrosser82
Reviews.Content: Hotel Maikol is simply fantastic. The staff is super friendly, helpful and personable. I felt like they treated me as a good old friend rather than just someone staying in a room. The room is clean and large! The bathroom is spotless and the shower, although small, is great! We had a room overlooking the park and it wasn't too noisy. I liked the view! Breakfast is served in your room every morning: fresh pastries, juice and hot drink of your choice (go for the cappuccino!). We could eat our delicious breakfast while still in our pajamas rather than rushing to get ready in order to meet the breakfast time. The location is great: right next to the (easy to use) Metro and also walkable distances to Termini and many major sites. In the evening it gets a bit quiet and I wouldn't walk alone (but I wouldn't do that in unfamiliar places anyways), but it's safe for two people to walk together. It is tricky to find, look for the MAS sign. I would stay here again without hesitation and I would tell friends to stay here, too. All these positives plus a reasonable price make Hotel Maikol a hidden gem in the Eternal City!

Reviews.Title: “Just read the great reviews, they're all true.”
Reviews.Author: JackMcDonald
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Maikol for three nights at the end of October prior to a cruise leaving from Civitavecchia. The size of the rooms, cleanliness, friendliness of staff are all as described in the other great reviews. The hotel is unique, it is located above a department store and shops. The street level of the building is under an arcade, look for a massive pair of oak doors with a brass plaque with the name of the hotel. Use the intercom, they will let you into the courtyard behind the doors. The hotel entry is on the right up two steps to the elevator up to the hotel. I do have a word of caution for elderly or travelers that may have issues with stairs, there are some stairs between the elevator stop and the hotel entry desk. The hotel is a family run business and they are very friendly and helpful, offering advice and maps on all the sights of Rome. The Colosseum and the Roman Forum are n easy walk from the hotel. They recommended excellent local restaurants, "Ristorante Leonetti" and our favorite a great little place with terrific food and service "Ristorante La Forchetta d' oro". Hotel Maikol is conveniently located, a 10 minute walk from Rome's main train station and next to a Metro stop. The Metro system can get almost anywhere in Rome and it very easy and safe to use. A tip to anyone staying in Rome prior taking a cruise ship from the port of Civitavecchia, take the train. We took the train without a problem. There are ticket kiosks at the station in English. The cost is 4.50 euros using cash as opposed to 19.50 euros if purchased online beforehand. Walk form the Train station in Civitavecchia to the entrance of the port (the old fort), about 750 meters and get a free shuttle to your ship. Hotel Maikol is a great place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: CherylInMainz
Reviews.Content: Perfect for a sightseeing trip. Within walking distance to the train station. A Metro stop on the corner, as well as bus and tram lines. Neighborhood was safe & active with sidewalk vendors and flower stalls. Many small shops in the area and only a couple blocks to restaurants. Hotel is small - about a dozen rooms - and very clean. Staff (family) were pleasant and all spoke English. Breakfast included was a nice surprise. Room with bath was an ample size and quiet. Already planning our next trip to Rome and will most certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with breakfast in bed”
Reviews.Author: alex1liz
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 5 nights. The owners were very nice and accommodating. The room was a good size and very clean. The bathroom was a good size. Every morning they would bring breakfast to your room on a tray at the time you requested (between 8am-10am). The breakfast included a cappuccino, yogurt and pastries. The hotel was easy to find if you read what others have written on how to get there. It is right by a metro line and very close to the train station. They had free high speed internet. It is not close to some of the more touristy areas so at times we found it a bit out of the way. Overall we really enjoyed it and would recommend it. The value can not be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Jewel”
Reviews.Author: Tustinman
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is excellent, it's a walking distance from the Termini Station, clean and quiet. Run by Elizabeth and her family, we were there October 4, stay four days and if I come back to Rome, I'll stay in this Hotel, absolutely!!!!!! The breakfast was great and they delivery to your room!!! they provided us with maps and told us where to eat cheap-Restaurant Leonetti is excellent , great food and service. The Metro station is very close to the Hotel (half a block) and we did not have a problem to find transportation.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet oasis in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Whatcom
Reviews.Content: We booked this delightful B&B based on the many favorable ratings on Trip Advisor. Thanks to the detailed reviews from fellow travellers we knew exactly how to find it and what to expect. Maikol was a perfect fit for us, and we enjoyed 6 quiet, peaceful nights in the middle of a busy city. And Betty's cappuccino is not to be missed!!

Reviews.Title: “a true gem in a big city”
Reviews.Author: katieseanmom
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel was perfect for our two night stay in Rome. The rooms were spacious and very clean. The morning continental breakfast was very good and served to your room at your desired time. The location is only a five minute walk from the Termini and the staff was always very friendly and welcoming. My husband and I would definitely stay there again on a return trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for a small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Holey-soles
Reviews.Content: Previous reviews of this hotel are quite accurate. It is hard to find (look for the MAS department store sign at the corner of one block on the piazza; handy for picking up all those items you forgot to pack) but conveniently located (metro station at the end of the block, one stop to the Termini station) to some attractions (Basilica Maria Maggiore - 5 min; pleasant 20 min walk downhill along the Via Monte Oppio to the Colosseo). Our room was spotless but with only a limited view of the inner courtyard. The bathroom is shiny, modern and the water pressure excellent. Bella Fiorella speaks passable English and has a well-rehearsed spiel about Rome and, more importantly, how to navigate the three layers of defense that allow you back into your room. Breakfast is delivered to your room at the time you specify and makes for a good start to the day. The coffee is very good and so is the mint tea. This hotel makes a good base for exploring Rome, which is a reasonably easy city to get around on foot, or by metro if your worn out from sight seeing. If you're happy with the basics well-done, this hotel is excellent value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: LINDAC71
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through looking at Trip advisor. Thanks to all who have written reviews. The hotel is perfect for a city stay in Rome. We had no problem finding the hotel, as our taxi driver took us straight to it. On arrival we were unable to check in as we arrived at lunch time. We left our bags and started our sight seeing. On our return our bags had been taken to our rooms and we were given the full low down on what to see and how to get around Rome. The rooms are basic but very clean and welcoming. The location is excellent, and i can only say that for the cost it feels like a 5 star. Breakfast good, i also liked that we were asked what time we would like it delivered to our rooms. Perfect in every aspect!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for Budget Travellers”
Reviews.Author: globalbetty1
Reviews.Content: Located on a higher floor of an old building right on Piazza Vittorio Emanuelle, Hotel Maikol is a small budget hotel that is a little hard to find as there isn't a big sign out front. The room is large, with basic amenities including a fridge, but there is no telephone in the room. Some visitors were allowed in to see us and were told they could only stay for ten minutes. One staff person was reluctant to make phone calls for us. As this might just be the fault of one employee, I would say Maikol is a good place to stay. The excellent location - easy to walk to all of the sites - decent breakfast, Free Wi-fi and absolutely delicious breakfast capucchino plus good price make it a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service.. good stay..Close to the Termini Train station”
Reviews.Author: jlhrox
Reviews.Content: Excellent Service.. good stay..Close to the Termini Train station.. hard to find..!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: HY_Oct2010
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a good location. Very clean and the hosts are very kind and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: MarthaLD
Reviews.Content: While certainly not luxurious, we received excellent service here at about half the cost of other hotels we stayed in it Italy, and found Maikol to be a great value. The room was very clean, they called a cab for us and recommended nearby restaurants, and they left us a special breakfast since we were leaving very early in the morning for our flight (well before the standard breakfast hours). We were only there for one night on our way out of the country, but found it to be convenient and a good, centrally located bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BoBoBabo
Reviews.Content: Wish i could write something that would be original but everybody else that wrote a review before me have already used the words ''Wonderful Stay'', ''Amazing Value'', ''Great Location'',''Great service'',Great Hidden Spot'', Fantastic Lady, Fantastic Price etc etc. The reviews from Crispygirl and bbbradk (11th october 2010) really says it all. We will be staying there again on our next trip to Rome

Reviews.Title: “Far exceeded my expectations - HIGHLY recommended to all”
Reviews.Author: RicheleE
Reviews.Content: Hotel Maikol is such a fantastic little hotel in the heart of Rome. I am usually the type who travels in luxury but tried to keep costs down in Europe so booked this 2 star hotel. I must say, it was the best hotel we found in Europe, even better than two of the four star hotels we stayed in. The staff were incredible, and went out of their way to help with anything we needed. The Italian breakfast was delicious and delivered to the room each morning; they do a great coffee, too. It was only a 5 - 10 minute walk to the Colosseum, and the same to the main shopping district. The room was spacious and comfortable, with sparkling new flat screen TVs. The bathroom was lovely, we had a nice view of the busy streets below and the park across the street. They also have free wi-fi high speed wi-fi, a big plus in my books. Breakfast is served from 8am but they got up two and a half hours early to deliver our breakfast before our flight, I don't know that I would get that service at any other 2 star hotel. I can't say enough good things about this hotel, and will definitely stay there again if I ever have the pleasure of returning to Rome. I couldn't recommend this hotel enough, it's a great price for a wonderfully well run, and sweet little Italian hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay in rome”
Reviews.Author: SandR14
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights at the Hotel Maikol in Rome. The hotel was a gem, situated close to a metro stop and only a 10 minute walk to Termini. It was also only a short walk to the Collosseum. The room was spotlessly clean, spacious and very comfortable. A continental breakfast was included in the price and was delivered to our room each morning. The staff at the hotel were lovely and happy to help us with all our queries. The hotel is located behind a large street door and we had to buzz to enter when we first arrived. We were given a set of keys to access the street door, apartment door and our room. It felt like we had our own apartment in the heart of Rome! It was easy to get to our room via stairs or lift. On our last night in Rome there was a tango festival in the piazza in front of the hotel. We watched for a while and then left our windows open to listen to the beautiful music that was playing.
