We were pleasantly surprised to get such a lovely place to stay for such a reasonable cost ( less if you paid cash) and would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Host, Great Location, Great Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: AndrewNCarmen
Reviews.Content: This well maintained hotel is in a very good spot right next to a metro station and within a ten to fifteen minute walk from the Termini train station. You couldn't ask for more from Elizabeth who is a fantastic host. We arrived early in the morning after a long haul flight and not only did we get an early check in, Elizabeth did a great breakfast for us as well. Thanks for making our welcome to Rome so easy and memorable! As per all the other reviews use the landmark of the MAS sign and it's worth doing a google earth streetview before you go as it would be a little difficult to find otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly and Helpful Proprietor and Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: GatorOFallon_IL
Reviews.Content: A good location, short walk to Termini station. Friendly and helpful proprietor - helpful with directions and where to eat locally. Large room with full size shower in bath. Loved having breakfast brought to us in the morning! Inexpensive hotel too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at Hotel Maikol”
Reviews.Author: Kathybear5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently took our first trip to Europe and started in Rome at the Hotel Maikol. The hotel was in a great location...within walking distance to the Termini Train Station, the Metro, and many restaurants/sidewalk cafes and sites in old Rome. We used previous reviewers comments to find the hotel (Entrance is through a solid wood door located next to the MAS Oro store). You need to press the button at the door and tell them you are there for the hotel). The hotel staff (Betty) was exceptional! She provided us with a map, gave us suggestions for restaurants, gave us tips on how to get around, and helped us with connections for our tours. She also provided us with a wonderful breakfast in our room each morning and made a special effort to provide it extra early on the day we were leaving to catch the train. Our room was clean, the bed was comfortable, and we will definitely stay here again when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value; great location and service”
Reviews.Author: crispygirl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were spending a week in Rome prior to a cruise and 3 days upon our return. We were looking for something that was under 100 Euros a night and was in a good location (no car). I had visited Rome before and stayed in the Termini area (near the train station) and found it was a great area to walk from and to get transit from. I started to look there and was lucky enough to find the Maikol. It had an elevator and air conditioning (2 of our requirements) as well as good reviews on trip advisor. We booked it for both the beginning and end of our trip. We arrived from the airport by taxi and it was a little tricky to find. There is no big sign out front but it is right beside a large discount department store named Mas that has a huge red/white sign so just look for that and you will easily locate the big wooden door. They buzz you up but there are a few wide marble steps (approx 6) you have to walk up from the elevator to the actual door of the hotel. Keep this in mind if you have a lot of luggage or mobility issues. It was not an issue for us and they are very helpful, so I am sure they would assist if you needed it. We arrived very early but were told we could leave our luggage and come back in half an hour and the room would be ready. When we returned our luggage was in our room. Betty (the owner) gave us a map and showed us how to get to everything by bus and also gave us site seeing and restaurant recommendations. Some quite close to the hotel. Those we tried were good. There is also a subway startion (metro) right outside the hotel. Termini is only 10 minutes walking which was also good for catching the hop on hop off tours, train to our cruise port and busses around the city. Walk around the square that the hotel is in there is a nice perfume shop (Limone), a few leather shops and some other cute shops and cafes. There is also a convenience store around the corner if you need drinks, snacks, toiletries etc. Breakfast is included in the room price. It is a continental breakfast with fresh pastries, yogurt, OJ and coffee or cappuccino. Trust me get the cappuccino - it was great and I looked forward to it every morning. They do not have a business center, but they do have free wifi. They also offered to let us use their hotel computer if we did not have our own wifi device. There was also an assortment of books on Rome that you could borrow. The room was large and very clean. It was not fancy but the bed was really comfortable and there was a small fridge. They provided drinks that were actually cheap (not like most mini-bars). There were complimentary candies in the room. The air conditioner worked great. I had read on several other hotel reviews that some hotels charge extra if you use the air conditioner - there was none of that nonsense there. The bathroom was a good size and included a bidet. The shower was small but typical for Europe. The only draw back was that the towels were not very absorbent. The material was more like tea towel fabric or cloth napkins. Still they gave you several and they were clean. I can not say enough about the service - everyone was super friendly and I very much enjoyed our stay. When we were leaving our prearranged taxi did not show up. I went back into the hotel to ask Betty to call our driver to see when he would be there. His phone was off. She offered to call a friend that has a car service and was able to get someone within 10 minutes to pick us up. His charge was 5 Euros more then the other company but well worth it for the quick service and it was still much less than we had paid to get to the hotel from the airport. She even had the young lady who was working there go down and wait with us because she knew the car. She made sure we got off okay and Betty gave us a wave from upstairs. It was a great trip and this hotel would definately be where I would spend my next trip to Rome as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hidden Spot”
Reviews.Author: bbbradk
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a fantastic trip to Rome. We booked at the Maikol based on the great reviews here, and the great price. The hotel as several had mentioned is a little hard to find, unlike most hotels there is no sign, simply a buzzer for them beside a large doorway. Getting the luggage up was a bit of a pain (we were in Europe for 3 weeks so had lots, had to take it through the large door, then get buzzed in to a second doorway inside, up 2 steps to the elevator, then down around 8 stairs on a wide set of spiral stairs leading to the door). Check in was easy, Betty told us that our room would be ready in about half an hour (we were checking in early) and gave us a map with suggestions on where to have lunch nearby. We dropped off our bags and headed out. Upon our return, our bags were waiting for us in our room. As well, Betty got us a new map and drew directions to pretty much anything anyone would want to see. The room was quite large with a big mural sticker behind the bed with some mountain range. There was a small flat screen tv mounted on the wall (reception was great, but here were no english channels at all lol) There was a remote for the tv, as well as one to control the rooms air conditioner (it worked really well, on a warm day you could make the room cool in only a few minutes) The bathroom was large with a toilet, bidet (never used one, so didn't start) and a shower (rather small, but par for the course in Europe). The only bad thing I would say about the bathroom is the towels, they were like napkins you would get from a restaurant, and the bath towel seemed like a large paper towel. My favorite part about staying here was the fantastic breakfast delivered every morning, it would have a few fresh pastries, some yogurt, orange juice, and a fantastic cappuccino. We still miss the cappuccino. The staff was always super friendly, and the neighborhood had a great location, easy to walk to many sights, and a subway right beside the hotel if something was not walking distance. On our final day we had prearranged a pick up from the cab that brought us to the hotel from the airport (all of the airport cabs offer a return trip for much less than the trip to the city, you just need to call ahead to book). We waited more than 20 minutes for our cab before asking the hotel to call and ask when he was coming. When they called, the driver had his phone turned off (even though we had prebooked the day before). The hotel called a driver friend of theirs who was there in a few minutes, and only charged 5 euros more than the discounted rate our cab had promised. We would certainly stay here again, and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: travelator39
Reviews.Content: This is a good choice if you want to be located close to town centre and would be using the Metro as your main mode of transportation in Rome. The Hotel owner is a very good lady and she is very helpful and goes that extra mile to make you feel comfortable. The only downside if any is that there is no signboard that can help you to locate the hotel in the Building. It is very confusing to find it if you come from the Vittorio Emanuelle Metro station. There are several exits in the station and taking the wrong one means you have to circumnavigate a huge roundabout. So check the location in google map first and note the street carefully. The hotel entrance is from a big Brown door which is adjacent to a big signboard with letters MAS in red color hanging from top. The breakfast is no frills but really you are getting what you are paying for, especially when you compare the prices that you pay at some other hotels in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Clean , friendly and well located B&B”
Reviews.Author: killianf
Reviews.Content: Hotel Maikol is an excellent B&B with spacious clean rooms, extremely friendly and helpful staff and only a stone's throw from the metro station. Excellent value for money, could not recommend this place higly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Top Location and Top Service”
Reviews.Author: FootballFeverNZ
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we were made to feel really welcome and Fiorella (hope Ive spelled that right) took the time to give us a map of central Rome and explain how to get to all the main sites. We were so impressed with her service that it immediately made the whole of Rome feel more hospitable. The room was quite big and was quiet enough. the Bathroom was spotless and quite modern. The Breakfasts were delivered to our room each day at the agreed time and there was definately enough to eat. A hot drink is included in the breakfast and having never ever been a coffee drinker I decided to get a Cappucino so my partner could have an extra one... well she never got near it because it was the first coffee Ive ever had that didnt taste like bitter dirt to me! Betty the owner makes the drinks herself and safe to say i had that coffee each day of the stay! Prime location and despite a lot of press about the area being bad we didnt feel unsafe. A Taxi with Luggage from termini cost us 7 euro total which was excellent. Overall this Hotel more than met our expectations and we would 100% stay there again. Oh, and free in room wi-fi!

Reviews.Title: “This place is cheap and near the train station. Everything else is dodgy.”
Reviews.Author: sgoldberg2
Reviews.Content: The neighborhood is pretty bad. We never would have found the place without guidance from other Tripadvisor visitors here. This hotel and several others like it are really just a small cluster of rooms in apartment buildings. Our hosts insisted on being paid the night before we left. Breakfast was lousy. The room was small. It was clean, though, and the shower was fine. They gave us four keys to each of the locks--the locks were needed--but the keys didn't work. This is a really basic place. It was fine for us because we wanted someplace low cost near the train station so we could get to the airport in the morning. If you're expecting more than a cheap bed, stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: ifphoto
Reviews.Content: We were received with a warm welcome and, frankly, surprised to see how spacious and sunny our room was. The hotel is very well kept - the rooms and bathroom spotless. The owner and other staff were excellent and they even bring your breakfast to your room in the morning. Great experience, great value of money, 1 minute from the metro, central... what more could you ask for. Incidentally, upon arrival at the Piazza Vittorio Emanuele it about 20 minutes to find the door to the hotel; Google Map's information is slightly off and many of the doors on the piazza have two numbers each! (For the record, the hotel's on the southern end of the western side of square; Google shows in on the southern end of the square.)

Reviews.Title: “Clean and spacious room and helpful owner”
Reviews.Author: SamnDaz04
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival Elizabeth showed us to our cool and air conditioned room which was a relief after travelling to Rome via both plane and bus in very hot weather . The room was spacious and fit for our needs. Free wifi (a big plus in our books) and a basic breakfast (pastries, yoghurt, juice, tea/coffee) included every morning. As per previous reviews, we found Elizabeth to be very hospitable and helpful. She pointed out places for us to eat and nearby attractions. She also packed us a breakfast the night before when we had an early day trip the next day and helped us decipher some train tickets that were written in Italian. A small (and reasonably priced) mini bar was available. The bathroom was very clean and our room cleaned daily. We were also able to leave our luggage on the morning of our check out which enabled us to continue sightseeing, rather than being bogged down with all our bags. The only thing we would mention was that if you are tall and get room 8, don’t expect much leg room whilst sitting on the toilet as it is a little cramped because the bathroom is the corner bathroom; we doubt however that it would be this situation in every room. We would definitely return to Maikol if ever in Rome again and thank Elizabeth for going above and beyond during our stay. Directions for future stays at Maikol: We agree with previous reviews stating that it was hard to locate Maikol. We turned right off Napoleone III and then asked for directions at another nearby hotel. We’ve uploaded some photos which hopefully may help give some familiarity to the area. Look for the big red ‘MAS’ sign, walk up to it and the hotel plaque is virtually on the wall to the right of where you are standing. Press the buzzer, Elizabeth will let you in and then go to the heavy glass door with black bars on it and press the buzzer again to be let into the foyer. Word to the wise, if you have heavy luggage like we did – take the lift! Maikol is on 2nd floor. Not suitable for disabled/wheelchair bound individuals.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Nancy_Ottawa
Reviews.Content: We stopped over in Rome on the way to Venice and wanted a place close to the the Termini train station. Hotel Maikol more than met my expectations for the price we paid. Nothing fancy in terms of accommodation, but clean, spacious, quiet and comfortable. The bathroom was nicely equipped with what appeared to be all new fixtures. The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet. Our breakfast - pastries, yoghurt, cappuccino.- arrived promptly at our room at the time we had arranged the evening before. On arriving, we were provided with a very helpful & thorough overview of major sites to see in Rome and how to get to them, as well as info on what was in the immediate area - all this in English. There is a park (Piazza Vittorio) across the street and the hotel is within walking distance to Santa Maria Maggiore Basilica. There are shops nearby to pick up food, drinks, wine & gelato and some very nice restaurants. And of course, it's within walking distance to Termini.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a fantastic city!”
Reviews.Author: Tinks75
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Maikol for 3 nights in August and can honestly say it was one of the best hotels we have stayed in. My husband and I have stayed in some 5 star hotels which could learn alot from Hotel Maikol about customer service, hotel cleanliness and staff friendliness. For anyone thinking about booking this hotel, and you really should!, a good tip is to take a look at the pictures posted by other reviewers and take note of the door the hotel is placed behind so you can find it easily. We will be staying here again on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Even though we had got our dates wrong...”
Reviews.Author: Olivewood1
Reviews.Content: Even though we had got our dates wrong, the Owner fitted us in for our first night and found us accommodation for second night elsewhere. She went beyond the normal bounds of helpfulness. Terrific little boutique hotel offering good value within bag dragging (just) distance of station.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for budget tourists”
Reviews.Author: MightyCipher
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights. Not your standard chain hotel. Room was large by Italy standards, but a bit bare. Definitely will not be confused for a 4 star hotel. The most important part (for me) is that it was very clean and the bed was comfortable. The hotel is just one floor within a bigger building, so it's a bit confusing to get to, but alright after you figure it out. Front desk person and owner are very, very nice and helpful. Free breakfast in the room is also a Noe touch. Location: very close (3 short blocks) to Rome Termini station and has a metro stop right in front of the building. It's a walkable distance from all major sites, but the immediate area doesn't feel as safe as I would like. It's a bit lonely at night and while I'd be okay for myself, I was afraid to let my wife walk out on her own. If we had realized how cheap taxi's were earlier in our trip, we probably wouldn't have had to experience the night walks home. I recommend it, but would probably stay elsewhere (fancier and closer to nightlife) on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Sweetest Breakfast and a haven in a city of a million impressions”
Reviews.Author: DidiDuck
Reviews.Content: I am quite old to pay my first visit ever to Italy, as my mother was so much younger in her days (and that was quite an event for her). Her images and stories of Italy always fueled my curiosity, and I found it quite a shame never to have visited Italy before, even I have visited other Mediterranean countries frequently and with lots of pleasure. So Rome, the ancient city full of Architecture and culture was a random choice, more based on the wonderfully cheap deal from Easyjet than a commited choice. It turned out to be an excellent choice for a first time Italy visitor, and the hotel Maikol had so much to do with the safe and wonderful experience, as it is fantastic to recapture your strengths after a full day walking around a city with so much impressions. First, the rooms have that bit of Mediterranean 70s/80s cosiness which can be a bit frilly for some, but I liked it for its home-like feel. The beds are wonderful, a bit on the harder side, but that is something I do not mind spending the time in a hotel (a softer feel makes me aware that several other people have slept on that same spot). I really loved that the aircondition would stay on even when I was away, so I could arrive in a fresh room. Not that Rome was explicibly hot during that time (a 28-30 c), but it is still a fresh feeling. As for the two women I saw running the hotel, they were so friendly. Often you feel that the friendliness of a person running a business (hotel) is fake, because it is their business (and money) to make you feel at home. Somewhat, especially with the blonde woman who was working there most of the time when I was around, I felt that they kind of cared about me in a more genuine manner. Breakfast was so super and lavishiously good...so much really good and sweet eateries and that cappucino alone is worth another visit to Rome. It was fantastic to receive a breakfast in bed. The hotel is really close to the railway station, only it took me a while circling the whole square, which is something peculiar I do as I always seem to take the side that has the destination I have to visit as last part, especially on squares (I have been in Barcelona for a total of 7 weeks and I still get lost at Placa de Catalunia). The park on the square had film screenings in the first week of July, which was lovely to see how the locals went to visit that. By the way, that did not affect the silence in the room from outside, because from outside in the noise was quite blocked. Sometimes I did hear some talking in the hallways, but not too much. With a gem like this, I kind of want to keep it a (not so) secret and not rave so much about it, but I really want Hotel Maikol and the women running it doing well because they do an excellent job.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful, very convienient, and great value for money.”
Reviews.Author: steve-norf
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about 10 minutes walk or one Metro stop from Termini. It faces a garden piazza and is about a 10-15 minutes walk from the Colosseum. It's a small family run hotel which will offer you a worthwhile discount for paying cash (you have to book but not pay via an agency). They were able to cope with a wheat-free breakfast (included in the price and served in the room) and were always on hand to answer questions. There is lift access but it isn't suitable for wheelchair users as there are still a number of steps to negociate. The rooms are fairly spacious by European standards, clean, very bright, recently decorated with air conditioning and a clean spacious shower (the tiled floor did get very slippery if it got wet). There aren't any bars/lounges etc but why would you want to stay in the Hotel when the whole of Rome is outside? We found it a great base to explore Rome from, we would return again and be happy to reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in a Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: oompahdave
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at this centrally located B&B. It is near Termini Station, the Metro is a few steps away, and the Colosseum is 15 minute walk. The rooms are very clean, but sparsly furnished, and the hostess Elizabeth is wonderful. Breakfast was simple, but good. This is not a full service hotel, but excellent value for simple, well cared for lodgings. The only problem is finding the place. There is no exterior sign, only a button with a small label amidst many other buttons for apartments in the building. Directrions provided are not adequate and even helpful shopkeepers nearby didn't know there was an unmarked hotel in the building. Once you find it, however, it's well woth it. A great find thanks to Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “great cheap little family run hotel in room”
Reviews.Author: bre028
Reviews.Content: fantastic little place to stay in rome, small and cosy- has a very family feel lady at desk was very nice and helpful..breakfast brought to our room was fantastic, some of the best cappuccinos ive had! good tv, comfy beds even though it was 2 singles pushed into one. good wifi...mini bar VERY reasonably priced location is OK fairly far from the main city but not too bad, right next to the metro- about 15 min walk to colosseum. difficult to find, no signs on the street, look for the hotel maikol buzzer on the door across from the park apart from that, will definitely stay there again and recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: MonaValeMark
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Maikol for 4 nights. I found the location super handy to the metro and Stazione Termini. The breakfast was great and came earlier the morning we had to leave. The staff were helpful and even rustled me up and iron when I needed to press a shirt. Lived up to the reviews.

Reviews.Title: “As wonderful as I expected.. and more”
Reviews.Author: TooMuchofTooLittle
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Venere after reading all the great reviews of it on trip-advisor, as a first stop for our two week long multi-destination Europe trip. Finding the hotel was a bit of a problem, specially since we got-off the wrong side of metro and circled the full Vittorio Emanuele.. Advice for fellow travelers - take the Via Carlo Alberto exit when you come out of the metro, and then just one right turn and you are there. The hotel is an apartment turned to a hotel - small, cosy and a good place to rest after a loong day in Rome. The reception staff and the owner were very helpful, and gave a free map of Rome explaining what to do and how - an excellent way to begin your tour. (We took a 2 day pass for metro and that was very helpful, specially when we went to the flea-market and mouth-of-truth, but that's another story). The breakfast was filling, and a good start to the day. There was a confusion at their end as to our charges (better to confirm your stay cost as soon as you land), but nothing that caused a big issue. A supermarket is just a hop-skip away, and recommended for cheap water if you are not fond of drinking from the many fountains in Rome. The rooms themselves are build in modern style, with an external, classical wooden window but an internal, noise-proof glass modern window. Bed was comfortable, and toilets clean and well-cared for. An excellent budget information in the heart of the city, would recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Find, Fabulous Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: EmilyHS
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Hotel Maikol for three nights at the beginning of the month. We could not have been happier with our choice. We found the location of the hotel to be excellent, within walking distance of both the train station and sites (Colloseum, Forum, Pantheon, etc). The Metro had an entrance on the same block as the hotel and was useful for traveling to the Vatican among other places. Betty, the proprietor, went beyond the call of duty when she helped me cut the lock off my suitcase after I stupidly locked the key inside. She accommodated our gluten-free needs by providing us with a gluten-free breakfast the three mornings that we were with her. Her cappuccinos were luxurious. Look no further when seeking lodging in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for the right price”
Reviews.Author: bay5side
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at that this hotel in June and could not be more pleased with the value. The room was extremely clean; bathroom appeared to be completely renovated and had all new shower, sink, etc. The room was fairly roomy and overlooked the street but was very quiet. When the shutters and windows were closed there was an inner panel that could be set to completely block out the sun (this feature was nice in that we flew in from New York and after touring for several hours we returned to the hotel and thought we'd take a short nap only to sleep 5 hours.) The point is that the room was dark and the hotel was extremely quiet. The front desk hostess could not have been more accomodating. The bed was fine but not great. That said, since we were out all day and were very tired at night the bed was not an issue. We arrived before the room was was ready and she immediatley offered to store our luggage in a safe place. Breakfast was brought to our room between 8:00 and 10:00 (at the time we requested). Choice of Coffee or Cappucino; juice, yogurt, freshly baked croissants and fruit pastry. A great plus. Hotel is in close proximity (about 6 blocks) from Termini train station. Very convenient for us since we were taking a train to the port to catch a cruise ship. Also very close to the metro. This section of town is a bit too quiet at night (althought I think it is safe) but not an area that was appealing for a walk or getting a drink or dinner. It's not a big deal to get to Piazza Navonna or Trevi Fountain area which is much more lively. If you are interested in convenience to the train station and lots of value for a fair rate this is an excellent choice. One word of advice - the entrance to the hotel is in a courtyard behind two masssive wooden doors. I suggest you get a Google street map to find the address (although the cab driver did not have a problem.) Once you are registered it is very easy and you are given a key to the outside doors, the hotel entrance doors and your respective room.

Reviews.Title: “Trip Advisor Reviews were right on!”
Reviews.Author: JulieV32
Reviews.Content: The place is so clean it sparkles. The family takes in great pride in running a nice place to stay. They are very helpful, however, not totally fluent in English--but we figured it all out. Definitely very helpful. The bed was comfortble. The air conditioning, however, needed to be improved in our opinion. We stayed in two different rooms (one before our cruise and one after). The one across from the piazza was a little noisey, but not too bad. The courtyard one was quieter. One morning we opened the windows and hears someone playing opera. What a pleasant memory of being in Rome. The breakfast was good and delivered on time. Be sure that if you go there to get the address and the picture that somebody included on one of the reviews. The large red MAS sign helps because you have to find their name on the buzz in box or you won't know it is there. I had trouble working the three keys to get into the place, but my husband did ok with them. We figured out a shorter way to walk from the termini (even with our luggage) and it wasn't too bad. They arranged a ride for fourty euros back to the airport. They have numerous tourist books for you to use if you need finding anything in Rome. Found a great restaurant right across from the cathedral Magorre (spelling) and sat outside and watched the traffic and people. The neighborhood is a little sketchy within two blocks. I never felt bad walking with my husband, though. I loved the restaurants and activity between the hotel and termini. I did feel that it was nice to get away from the touristy section. The people running the place run a very clean and honest place. I don't think you will be disappointed--check the air conditioning, though! Internet connection was slow and didn't work at times. She let us use the computer at the desk to print out boarding passes. Very caring and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money in Italy”
Reviews.Author: IandJ10
Reviews.Content: The reviews below say it all. We stayed in many hotels in Italy, and this was by far the best value for money. We are extremely light sleepers, had a room overlooking the courtyard and didn't hear a peep. There was a little noise from people entering their rooms, but nothing that disturbed us. The room was spotless, my boyfriend is extremely allergic to dust and the room didn't even raise a snuffle. The mini bar was extremely reasonably priced. The breakfast was definitely more than enough for two people and the service was so fantastic that although we changed our breakfast time over and over it was always met with a smile and accommodated. We also loved breakfast being brought to our room. The bed was so comfortable that we didn't even realise until the second day that it was two singles pushed together, you couldn't feel the join at all. We had the best sleep in all of Italy in that bed especially as the air conditioner was perfectly positioned and powerful with limited noise. The hotel is hard to find, but with the street number and the knowledge that it's on a corner, with only a small plaque next to the door, we found it immediately. Keep in mind that although it's about 10 minutes walk from the sites, it is right next to the train station that takes you to all of them if you're feeling lazy.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Hotel, not as great location”
Reviews.Author: MidnightandBalloo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Maikol for 3 nights in May. Room: The room was spacious and literally clean enough to eat off of (not that we did, but seriously). The bed was quite comfortable and the air conditioner worked WELL and was much needed. The bathroom was typically European - small. However, not the smallest we had in Europe. There was also a mini-fridge which we found handy. Staff: Every person working at this family-owned B&B spoke good English, and all were kind and helpful. They marked everything we needed to find on the map and recommended a good reataurant for dinner. Housekeeping was excellent. Breakfast: Typical "Italian Style" breakfast, which means sweet pastries, yogurt, jiuce, and cappucino. The pastries were top quality and maybe the best we had in Rome. The cappucino was excellent. Location: First of all, the hotel is NOT well marked. It seems to be located within a residential complex, so the first door you go through (they have to buzz you in) looks like you are entering where someone lives. Look for the adress number on the building, then closley at the buzzer list for "Hotel Maikol". The nieghborhood in which this hotel is located is... questionable. I was with my husband and always felt safe, but I would not venture out at night if i were a solo female traveler. There are literally 3 locked doors, not counting your room, that you have to pass through to get into the hotel, so the place itself is certainly safe and secure. One downside is the Vottorio Emmanuele Square acrross the street. It is a very busy public park and they were having some sort of festival when we were there that included late night concerts (ending around midnight). We are early-risers when we travel so, despite the double-paned windows (which WOULD block out normal traffic noise), we were kept up late by awesomely bad covers of such artsists as the Cranberries and Sublime. Overall, we would recommend this hotel to most travelers and would certainly stay there again ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: badlittlekiwi
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed in this little B&B at the beginning of June and I highly recommend it as a great place to stay in Rome. The location is good, really close to the train station (but not noisy at all), and near some nice pizza places. Our room was large, modern and clean and the breakfast we were served each morning was delicious. Personally we did not enjoy Rome at all as a city and are in no hurry to ever return... but if we did Hotel maikol is where we would stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good bang for your buck in Rome”
Reviews.Author: LinzandT
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome and were pleasantly suprised to find that Hotel Maikol was within 5 minutes of the train station. We read that other guests had been dissapointed with the location but we found it to be just right. 10 minute walk to the Coliseum and a abundance of affordable restaurants that had more of a "local" flavor than other parts of the city. The more we got around the city the more we were relieved to not be staying in one of the more touristy areas. Our room was spacious, had AC, and came with a substantial breakfast delivered at our requested time. Pastries, juice, lattes, and Nutela is truly the breakfast of champions! After going from one end of Rome to the other it's hard for me to imagine more value for 90 euros in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and great value”
Reviews.Author: Maya0608
Reviews.Content: The staff here were truly wonderful. What the hotel might have lacked in frills and amenities was more than made up for in hospitality, value and convenience. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: h0neybear
Reviews.Content: We loved our time and Rome and we stayed at Hotel Maikol. The breakfast is all you need and the people were very friendly. If you are active you can walk to most of the old Rome sights. If you want to save your energy for the sights just jump on the metro it is nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to all the good reviews”
Reviews.Author: PonchotheSane
Reviews.Content: We read so many good reviews for this location that we had to give it a shot. We took a Mediterranean cruise and decided to stay in Rome before and after our trip. We made the Hotel Maikol our bookend home during those days. We were very pleased. Simple, clean and excellent service. We stayed in two different rooms and we preferred the smaller room facing the courtyard over the larger room facing the street. If you are a very light sleeper, please request the courtyard. Regardless, the noise was not overbearing or obnoxious. There was a difference between the two rooms, though. If you don't have any issues with a little traffic noise, the street rooms are substantially larger. It should be noted that even the smaller room was quite large in terms of European hotel rooms. We slept with the windows open and the room was a perfect temperature. The rooms were decorated in a simple and clean way. Both of our rooms had a huge photo over the bed (kind of like a photographic headboard is the best way I can describe it) that was sort of weird for US standards, but they were pretty pictures... so "when in Rome, do as the Romans" was how we looked at them. Odd, but pleasant. The bathrooms were well equipped and well lit. There was a bidet that neither of us chose to use (let's be honest... we don't ever use them in Europe, nor do we probably even want to know how to use them), a toilet, sink and a small corner shower. The bed was pretty nice. We've slept on better, but we've slept on TONS that were a lot worse. I will comment on something another reviewer commented on. The towels. FIRST, they smelled great. We have had some really bad smelling towels over the years. These smelled awesome. Whoever washed them, did a great job. The scent wasn't overwhelming, it was pleasant and spa-like. SECOND, the other reviewer is correct... what in the world kind of towels were these? There were two giant handkerchiefs and two large bar towels. We used one of the giant handkerchiefs as a bathmat and one as a hand towel. Neither towel did much to absorb any water whatsoever. We used the large bar towels as bath towels. Pretty much the same result, we were still quite wet after attempting to dry off. The Maikol staff let us drop off our bags early, as both visits we arrived prior to check-in. No problems AT ALL. They were pleasant and helpful in this regard. Our bags were moved to our room (they were nice enough to ask our permission to do so) when they were ready. They also arranged a very nice taxi to take us to the airport on our final day. They made sure the taxi could accommodate our luggage and the driver was prompt and efficient. The location is very convenient. Just a walk of mere feet to the Metro and a 10-15 minute walk to Termini. You don't want to put your luggage on the Metro. You want to walk from Termini to the hotel. You might consider a taxi if you have too many bags. The location isn't the classiest neighborhood, but it seemed safe and quiet. Fairly typical for Rome, lots of graffiti and street vendors. PLEASE MAKE SURE YOU LOOK AT THE PHOTOS OR GOOGLE STREET VIEW TO MAKE SURE YOU CAN FIND THE HOTEL. It is just a plain brown door next to a MaS sign and across the street from the flower stall at the park. The "138" is quite small in relation to the door. We looked at the photos and had zero problems. You will need to ring the bell and be buzzed in two separate times. They will give you keys to these doors, for you to come/go as you please, after you check-in. The breakfast was served in our room and consisted of orange juice, cappuccino, pastries, the standard packaged dipping toast and yogurt. It was simple, but nice. The breakfast shows the identity crisis that Maikol has. It's called the "Hotel" Maikol, but is listed as a "B&B". It looks like a hotel, but the staff behaves like a B&B. There is no dining room or sitting room. Either way, we enjoyed it a lot. The owner Barbie was quick to respond to an email question I sent her prior to our arrival. She was having knee surgery during our first stay, so we didn't get to meet her until our second stay. It was easy to see that she was very polite and obviously cares a lot about her location. Her adult son does not speak English, but he was very nice and very helpful. We spoke to him in our limited Italian and gestures. He carried my wife's bags for her. We saved the best for last. Most of our service was handled by Fiorella (she told us a nice story about how she "adopted" the Italian word for flower when she moved to Italy as her real name Tzvetelina also means flower) and she treated us VERY well. She was warm and friendly. She made dinner recommendations that were EXCELLENT. She was very good with a map (I spent many years as a map maker, I respect this) and she made good recommendations when we asked her opinion on the route we had planned out. We can truly say that she went above and beyond in being helpful and kind. She really made a good stay, great.

Reviews.Title: “Cute little hotel”
Reviews.Author: JulieRL
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here on our tour of Italy because the reviews sounded so good and the price was definitely right. We enjoyed our time and loved being served breakfast "in bed" every day. I will say that I don't agree that this is a great location. It's very close to the main train station Termini, but it's far away from all the hot spots in Rome (Spanish Steps, Piazza Navona, Vatican). We had to take the metro everywhere, which isn't a huge problem but the metro closed before we got back to the hotel twice and we had to walk or take a cab back. The whole area around the hotel shuts down and there are few to no restaurants/caffes open for dinner. At the end of our trip we returned to Rome for one night and had to stay in a different hotel. The noise of traffic all night kept me up, so maybe staying out of the rush is better because Hotel Maikol was definitely quiet and peaceful. I rated it high and I do recommend it, but I would think twice if sitting in a cafes until midnight is what you like to do in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, basic accomodation, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: lifesci99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Maikol for one night before flying home the following morning, chosen solely on the strength of the reviews here and the convenience of its location - it is just down the street from the Vittorio Emmanuel metro stop, and a ten minute walk to Termini Station. Yeah, the location is a bit sketchy (as most neighborhoods surrounding train stations are) but not unsafe - just a lot of low-end stores and cafes. The room itself is spacious and clean; one minor quibble would be the towels - the bath towels resembled over-sized tea towels, only less absorbent, and these were accompanied by what appeared to be table linens. But the staff are friendly and accomodating; breakfast is delivered on a tray to your door - hot beverage of your choice, a small glass of orange juice, a pastry, thick melba toast packages that seem to be ubiquitous in Italy with an assortment of spreads, and yogurt. Our room overloooked the courtyard and was very quiet. Would definitely recommend if you are looking for clean, no-frills accomodation, and good value for 90 euro a night.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, good base, great value.”
Reviews.Author: somuchmore2see
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the early May bank holiday. It was a 15 minute walk from Termini (once we'd figured out the direction from where the airport bus dropped us) but just round the corner from the Vittorio Emanuele Metro station if you don't fancy the walk. It's an easy 20 minute walk to the Colosseum (or you can get the Metro) and 15 minutes by Metro to the Vatican. I can see what others say about the area but it seemed pretty safe and there were a number of good places to eat. We had a fabulous meal 5 minutes away at La Forchetta in Via S. Martino ai Monti 40. Easily our best meal, and best value, of the weekend. The hotel itself is accessed through a big brown door off the western corner of the Piazza, next to a big MaS sign. It's easy to find if you've looked it up on Google Streetview beforehand. The door takes you into a courtyard and a second door, then up a lift / stairs to the 2nd floor. There's a friendly reception and the rooms are off from there. Ours was light, airy, modern and comfortable. There was a an A/C unit but it wasn't hot enough for us to need. It had a TV a phone and a mini bar. The guy on the helpdesk gave me the wifi access code so we had (slow) wifi access for our stay. Breakfast is served to your room at a time of your choosing. Not as good as a dining room but a good compromise. The cappuccinos were excellent! All in all, we thought the place was ideal as a base and great value without sacrificing comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in Rome”
Reviews.Author: whytelightnin2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a total of three nights. The location is very convenient, as it is only a ten-minute schlep from Termini, and it is half a block away from the Vittorio Emmanuele metro stop. The Maikol faces a lovely park, and the square is fairly quiet. The rooms themselves are much more spacious than I expected, and they were comfortable and very clean. They are not particularly stylish, but if you are on a budget, this is a great place to stay. The staff were the best feature of this place. It has a homey, family-run feel and all the staff were extremely accommodating. When we arrived, one of the proprietors wrote our location on a street map and told us how to get to all the major sites, as well as recommending a couple of local restaurants. It was really helpful, as we found it very easy to get lost while walking around Rome. Our bags were brought to the room for us, despite the fact that we were right around the corner from the reception. The staff will ask what time you want your breakfast and bring it to your room very promptly. Breakfast consists of jam, nutella, pastries, grissini, and yogurt, plus tea or coffee and orange juice. It was definitely nice to have breakfast brought to us, and the pastries were fresh and delicious. Free wifi is available, but the signal isn't too good if you're not close to the reception area. The place itself is rather basic, but the staff really go out of their way to make you feel welcome. We liked the Maikol so much that when we were stranded due to the volcano in Iceland, we immediately called them up and asked if we could stay there. They were fully booked, but offered to help us find another hotel (sadly, we did not take their recommendations). But we did stay there a couple of nights later, after staying at a much worse but similarly priced hotel about 10 minutes away. At 90 E a night, the Maikol is a great bargain, without any of the negative aspects of European budget hotels. Just make sure you remember the address- the sign is a little small.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectation...plus Great Value.”
Reviews.Author: twiles
Reviews.Content: Of all of the places we stayed in Italy, I was worried about Hotel Maikol the most. Could such an inexpensive hotel be rated so high? What was the catch? What a relief it was when we got there. All of the reviews are spot on. Great price, great location, great rooms, great breakfast served at your door, free internet, and fantastic service. Hotel Maikol is a classic example of why TripAdvisor is so valuable. Here is a small, inexpensive family-run hotel rated #24 out of 1200+ hotels. Book your stay at Hotel Maikol with confidence

Reviews.Title: “Nice B&B , well connected, but not a great locality”
Reviews.Author: Harshvardhan_s
Reviews.Content: This is a cosy B&B situated near the Termini railway station.Being close to Termini it is well connected to all the sights in the city. The rooms are spacious and clean and the service is excellent. I was specially impressed by the fact that since we were leaving early in the morning they left packed breakfast for us the night before. However the immediate surroundings are a little run down. This would be a great value for money, for someone who is not too bothered about the immediate vicinity of the place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, clean, comfortable, convenient, safe, trustworthy, excellent!”
Reviews.Author: grlantrn13
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days at the Hotel Maikol last week and loved being there. If you read nothing else, understand that we left my wife's wallet there accidentally. They contacted us immediately and made arrangements to get it back to us. Once we received it, all the cash and credit cards were 100% undisturbed. These are some very trustworthy people who care about their guests! The hotel is more of a B&B just so you know what you're in for. It is located immediately next to the subway station for Piazza Vittorio Emanuelle II, and if you get out on the right corner of the Piazza, is just a 20 yard walk to the front door. (Door is an unmarked big wooden door right next to a shop called Mas). If arriving at Termini train station, it's just one stop away on the Red line. Some people on here complained that the neighborhood was shady, but we didn't really feel that at all. There are several street vendors who are of various minorities (pakistani, asian), and this may have turned some less open minded travelers off, but it seemed totally safe to us. You can walk to the Coliseum and Roman forum in 15 minutes, or easily hop on the subway to any other destination. It isn't a hotel proper, but rather several rooms (set up just like your average hotel room with windows, bathrooms, etc) in a building that are owned by a family who happens to live amongst them. Don't be expected to be blown away by beauty and charm, it's pretty strictly a functional hotel rather than a resort. We arrived too early to check in, but they took our bags in and kept them safe while we explored the sights. They don't seem to have a phone number available on their website or anywhere else online, so if you had to call them for some reason before arriving, I'm not sure how you'd do it. We dealt with 3 people the whole time and they all spoke varying degrees of english. None was fluent, but we got by, and their friendliness and willingness to try to understand made up for any language barrier. Breakfast was delivered right to our room every morning at the time of our choosing. It consisted of croissants filled with jelly, orange juice, cappucino, and toast and nutella. It was quite delicious and saved us money on breakfast each day. The room was quite big and the bed was actually comfortable (most euro hotels have stiff beds it seems). There was free wireless internet, but the signal was weak. We really enjoyed our stay here and would highly recommend this place to anyone interested in a great bargain. No complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - great value”
Reviews.Author: Trelde
Reviews.Content: Very nice and helpful staff - very clean - comfortable beds - very close to the Metro - nice renovated rooms and bathrooms - nice breakfast at the rooms. A little difficult to find the entrance door.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault service or cleanliness, Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: LukeOz
Reviews.Content: My wife and i travelled to rome for the weekend and could not fault the staff in any way at all. They were very helpful and friendly and went out of their way to help us feel more comfortable. The location was great, 5 min walk from Termini Station and also 10 min walk to Colesseum. My tip would be to try a resturant just down from the hotel en route to the Colesseum. As you walk towards the Colesseum in the most direct route you will come across a small restaurant which i think is called Tempio Di Mecenate, it is opposite the cinema. The food is brilliant and at a very affordable price, the staff are very friendly which also helps! All in all our stay was great and we would definatly go back to the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place with nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Aria1386
Reviews.Content: It was much better than what we were expecting. Nice staff, good location, clean room, good breakfast which is served at room, free wireless internet make an unforgettable stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place”
Reviews.Author: bairesgirl77
Reviews.Content: Hotel Maikol is a great little hotel for a good price. It's walking distance to nearly all the main attractions in Rome and as a single girl traveling by myself, I felt very safe there. The rooms are clean, the breakfast is generous and good, and the service is great. The owner (Elizabeth) and staff are good, honest people. I forgot a ring and bracelet in my room's bathroom on my last day in Italy and realized it when I was at the airport on my way back home. I called the Elizabeth from the airport to let her know, then sent her my mailing info so they could send them to me in the US. A few weeks later I received my jewelry! I would definitely stay there the next time I'm in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value in a convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: amylynnc
Reviews.Content: Hotel Maikol is just a short walk from Termini Station and easy to find. They allowed us to check in a bit early, which was a blessing for my fiancee who had just flown in from the US. The room was spotlessly clean, very spacious, and looked out across to a flower stand. We had a mini-fridge, which was perfect for stashing snacks and wine bought at the little supermarket down the street. They also let us borrow a corkscrew for our entire stay - thanks! The staff was kind and helpful pointing out buses and giving approximate travel times on the metro to certain areas. The bathroom was small but functional - not that different from most hotel bathrooms in Italy! Overall, the location was fanstastic - just 15 minutes to walk to the Forum, immediately outside of Metro line A (Vittorio Emmanuele stop) and just a 5-10 minute walk to the Metro line B (Cavour). All in all, a fantastic spot to stay in Rome for a phenomenal price. Next time I'm in Rome, you'll find me at Hotel Maikol!

Reviews.Title: “Thrilled with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: dougalbean
Reviews.Content: Could not fault this hotel. Though the animal print bed spread and the alpine mountain wall mural were a bit 'out there' in our room, it just served to give the place a home-y feel. This was heightened by the family running the hotel who were ready to answer all our questions and able to give good advice on places to eat, buses to catch and walking distances. Location also great - a few minutes walk from the main train station, and also walking distance to the old Roman sites like the colosseum and Roman Forum. Breakfast was included in our room rate, and I would recommend seeking out this inclusion. The tray of hot drinks, juice and pastries is brought to your room at your specified time and enables breakfast in bed every morning. Ask for the hot chocolate - delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Super little hotel for 50 euros a night”
Reviews.Author: StaffordshireCraigH
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on trip advisor and for the price could not believe the reviews but they were all true. We paid 50 euros a night and the hotel was excellent. The rooms were spacious and very clean and the family that run the hotel were very friendly and welcoming. The hotel is located on a square about 10mins or so from the termini, the hotel itself is above a shop and although they have a small reception area thats about it. On arrival we were welcomed and given a very handy map of Rome which we used throughout our stay. We were then taken to our room which was very clean and well kempt, the bathroom was also very clean with a good shower. Me and partner walked to all the major attratcions from the hotel and althought the Vatican was a good walk, all other attractions were around a 15-20min walk. A minute walk from the hotel was the underground station which for a euro could get you any where in the city. When walking back at night we felt safe enough around the area as there was normally alot of people around the shops on the square. Would definitly use Makiol hotel for any future trips to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent for visit rome"”
Reviews.Author: SergioConchinha
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel to visit Rome, great location, it is possible to walk to the center of Rome and the main attractions for those who like walking, for those who do not like this, near enough for transport, about 5 minutes walk and subway to 1 minute from outside the hotel, receptionist very friendly and attentive, gave us a map of the main attractions and time away from the hotel, always at our disposal, excellent breakfast, excellent room, in short an excellent price-quality , I wish in all European capitals to have a visit to this hotel as value for money, I think the only thing that had to review was the heating was not always on, which made the room somewhat cold. when i return to Rome, certainly I will be at Hotel Maikol

Reviews.Title: “Nice, hotel within easy distance of all the sites”
Reviews.Author: BodgerParis
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very easy to get to as it is around a 10min walk (with luggage) from the main train station (terminus) and this is where the coaches from both Rome airports drop you off. The entrance of the hotel is not obvious so it is a good idea to take the No. of the Piazza. The entrance is right next to a big shop called 'Mas'. The room was clean with a clean shower, sink and toilet which all appeared new. I have stayed in some bad places in European cities before and i was pleasantly surprised here. The hotel is within walking distance of the Colliseum/ruins and many other sites. There is a Metro stop outside the hotel. The hotel reception gave us a map as soon as we arrived and highlighted all of the major tourist attractions and which metro/bus lines they were on - very handy. It was also close to San Lorenzo which is where the locals on that side of town go to eat. Try 'Formula uno' for pizza when you arrive. Two down points are that the piazza is not a nice one where you can sit and drink a coffee or have a meal. It is just cheap clothes shops and kebab houses. Also it is noisy from cars and bikes in the evening. However you could probably get a room not overlooking the piazza. I had no complaints about this hotel and would recommend it as a cheap, clean, no frills hotel and the women who runs it was great. Room service for breakfast meant we didn't need to eat again for a while.

Reviews.Title: “Great Jumping Point for Trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: PHLNonstop
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights during a quick jaunt to Italy. The hosts were fantastic -- sent me to great spots within Rome and made recommendations. Very patient. The breakfast was delivered at the time we specified. Perfect! I enjoyed it: pastries, coffee, orange juice. Nothing like a hearty American breakfast, but was great, none the same. The room was quite simple, with a small TV. As far as suggestions for the owners: maybe upgrade the TVs to flat screen and get some more exciting paint colors and more striking bedding. Other than that, the basics of the room are all there. It was immaculately clean and in a great location, right at a Metro stop.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget find at a great location”
Reviews.Author: osoosh
Reviews.Content: No frills bed-and-breakfast. Very centrally located (10 minutes walk from Termini), and run by very friendly and helpful people. We are happy customers, and would not hesitate to recommend this place for any budget traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Ecellent hotel and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Traveller318
Reviews.Content: Really friendly staff with good clean rooms right next to metro line and some main tourist attractions. Difficult to right thou ask flower guy opposite if you cant find it. Buzz yourself in through double wooden doors. If you take advise from this site for how to find you wont have a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodation and very friendly hosts”
Reviews.Author: donaBristol
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights - Elizabeth and her family all very kind and welcoming, breakfast was good, it was a nice touch to have it brought to your room. hotel was very clean - only noise was from her young daughter one morning but that was because it was snowing and they have not had snow for 25 years !!!!!! so she was very excited. Would stay here again as location was brilliant, we did not find the area to bad, convenient for metro and a 10 min walk from main termini station. The restaurant that they recommended was also nice for a special meal. It was a little difficult to find so make sure you remember the MAS supermarket and the huge door is right next to it. (picture taken by previous guest is very useful).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: Layl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome for 5 nights altogether on our way to and from Israel. The hotel is in somewhat shady area but just one subway stop from Termini. The owner was very pleasant and helpful. We arrived early and they kept our luggage. The breakfast was always on time and fresh. The room was large and clean, and no problem with outside noise

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money !!!”
Reviews.Author: LancashireStanian
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 night stay at the Maikol, we could not fault this B&B/Hotel. The service was excellent, the staff are very helpful and give great advice on the sights of Rome and recommend a lovely restaurant nearby which serves a range of good value true Italian food. We would not hesitate to recommend the Maikol to friends and family and would definitely return again soon !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Brockstrap
Reviews.Content: Girlfriend and I stayed here for three nights at the start of eight day trip in Italy. Very conveniently located only 5 mins walk from the main termini, so easy to find the area with a little help from Google map print-out. Did have some difficulty in finding the actual building though... don't expect a large, lit-up sign with the Hotel's name on - more a postage-stamp sized brass plaque on the walk. Room very clean and decent size - views over the Vit Emanuelle Plazza. Noise wasn't a problem. Location was good but if went to Rome again would probably prefer to stay in Traverse as we found there was a bit more happening at night for a young couple - ie bars and better restaurants. Service and staff great - nice breakfast delivered to your room in the morning, croissants, juice and cappacino. Helpful in suggesting places to visit etc and transport.

Reviews.Title: “a little gem”
Reviews.Author: walterboydsforehead
Reviews.Content: just returned from 4 days in rome,being a regular traveler to rome i have never stayed in this part of rome before but as the price was so good decieded to give the maikol a bash,what a pleasant suprise the area around it is fine,metro next door and termini 5min walk away.the hotel its self is spotlessly clean,big rooms,lovely view over the park oppisite also nice to be served breakfast in the room at whatever time you like.the ladies who run the hotel are really helpful and nice in fact i cant fault the place at all.i have stated in numerous hotels in rome for more than double the price of this place and maikol is as good or even better,so if youve got any sense book this place and spend the money you save on enjoying roma.

Reviews.Title: “Super value”
Reviews.Author: MrsClerk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just for the night when we arrived in Rome by train. The hotel Maikol is within walking distance from the station and we found it no problem with our google map. The friendly staff in the hotel very kindly kept our baggage safe while we explored Rome, and it was in our nice, clean double room with en suite bathroom when we returned. Our key and the exterior lock didn't seem to fit very well and we really struggled to open the door a couple of times when returning, but it opened eventually. We found the location very handy for the station and we did walk into Rome from the hotel too, we like walking, but it was quite hard going and sticky on the way back after touristing around all day. I liked the breakfast they brought to our room, yogurt, pastries and coffee. My man likes a more substantial breakfast but these are hard to come by in Italy in general! We felt safe coming and going around the hotel, and I liked the feeling that it was a part of Rome that people actually lived in. I would definitely stay there again, great value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel. Clean, Cheap and Quiet.”
Reviews.Author: Costa_Neto
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on Trip Advisor, and we don't regret. It's clean, cheap and quiet, even the front room, with the window turn to the street. The friendly family that own the hotel provide a excellent service. They are very kind. They have internet wireless. The metro station is 50m of the hotel, and 10 minutes walking to Colosseum. It's not so hard to find, but is a entire floor of a building, so you have to look for the number of the building. It's a excellent cost/benefit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: spanougakis
Reviews.Content: Owned and operated by a family, they provide excellent service. A little bit difficult to locate it, keep in mind street number 138. There is a metro station next door. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: echobey
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel solely for its close proximity to Stazione Termini knowing we'd only be there for our first night in Italy and then be moving on. We liked the location and the clean, spacious room and asked our hosts if there was availabilty when we returned to Rome in a week and a half. They said yes and we booked four more nights. While in another part of Italy, they realized they made a mistake and there was actually no availability when we were to return and emailed me offering to find us another comparably priced hotel for those four nights. They even personally walked us to the new hotel when we returned to Rome. A great hotel and such accomodating hosts! We'll be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted!”
Reviews.Author: smtcan
Reviews.Content: We were spending two nights in Rome before embarking on a cruise, so we wanted inexpensive accommodation close to the Termini Station. Hotel Maikol filled the bill for us. As other posters have mentioned it wasn't easy to find the hotel, but pictures on this site helped. The walk from the station took about ten minutes, even with suitcases. The view from our room wasn't inspiring, however being at the rear meant that it was very quiet. The room was not large, but had everything we needed and was immaculately clean, as was the bathroom. The staff were very helpful with directions and restaurant recommendations. This is not luxury accommodation, but represented excellent value for money in an expensive city where we spent all day sightseeing so just needed a place to sleep. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great view but noisy.”
Reviews.Author: Albanella
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in this hotel in October. The hotel is located in the Piazza Vittorio Emanuele and you can miss it, if you are looking for a hotel! You will need to buzz yourself in through double wooden doors and again through another door before you can catch the lift to the hotel reception...as usual of these types of hotels, there are some steps to climb. The staff were wonderful and the breakfast is served in your room (pre booked from the night before). The rooms are average size, very clean and the bathroom was very new and spotless, however I found this hotel very noisy even though we had the windows closed (our window faced the Piazza and all its traffic).My other complaint was that the bed was very uncomfortable considering you are paying slightly more than some other 3 star hotels in Rome . If you are staying at this hotel make sure you arrive during the day (so you can find it) and request the rooms on the other side of the piazza.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: Cary_NCTarHeel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights in mid-November. The hotel name is on their street buzzer system, so don't look for a big eyecatching sign. But with the address in hand, you will soon locate it. The place is immaculate, also VERY quiet. Plenty of space. Breakfast in your room works out fine. We were expecting to be hungry and have sugar highs since it's an Italian breakfast -- pastries, toast, coffee, juice -- no cereals, yogurt, fresh fruit. But we were very surprised that we did perfectly fine each day until lunch time. So it worked for us. The staff is very nice, and ready with maps and directions. We enjoyed the neighborhood -- found a closeby grocery shop, a fabulous bakery, and informal pizza places. Termini is close enough to walk to to make train reservations. And the Metro is just up at the other end of the block, and we took that to Ottaviano for St. Peters, etc. So all in all, this is a fine place to stay. Not fancy-schmancy, and no "gathering" rooms like a lounge or dining room (which is why they deliver breakfast). Oh, and it had no internet access for guests but shops are in the area you can use, if necessary. But if you are in Rome alone or with a friend or two, this place is perfectly fine. We would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Maikol is amazing”
Reviews.Author: lizzyzonster
Reviews.Content: Thanks to trip advisor I've booked in the hotel and I'm very happy. Everything that was said here is true. The hotel is very clean, very nice, very warm! It was in what it looked like a rough area but I had no problem with anyone. Me and my boyfriend arrived late at night and we went by metro to the hotel. When you get out of the metro, take the left exit then the first right then left again. very good hotel, i recommend to everyone. The bed is amazing, is very confortable and warm. ah! the breakfast is served in the room at the time you want (between 8am and 10am). sorry for my english, I'm from Portugal.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value B&B w/Close Accessibility to the Metro”
Reviews.Author: katskills
Reviews.Content: Our hostess was very hospitable upon our arrival and throughout our stay. She provided us recommendations of places to go see and eat. They serve breakfast brought to your room consisting of pastries, juice, and cappuchino at the time of your choice. The room was very clean and spacious, yet average in terms of decor. The metro is about 5 minutes walking distance away so that was definitely convenient. Although the room and bathroom were cleaned everyday, we noticed that they didn't change the sheets everyday. I guess I'm used to a daily change in sheets when I stay in a hotel in the U.S. so I was a little turned off by this. If you're looking for a good budget, no frills place to stay in Rome with convenient transportation and accessibility, I would recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “The greatest litlle hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: pln1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were late Oct.2009 four days in Rome where we stayed at the charming B & B Maikol. The hosts were incredibly helpful and friendly. We ate breakfast at the newly renovated room, where we had lots of coffee and cakes. The room has a TV and a mini fridge. Beds are great. Nice shower in the bathroom, which also has a hairdryer. The cleaning was excellent. WiFi available. And now you also get your own key (yes, actually 4 keys: 1 for the main door, 1 for the door to stairs / elevator, 1 for entrance to the hotel and the room 1). We can only give our warmest recommendations Maikol.

Reviews.Title: “perfect accommodation”
Reviews.Author: korynka
Reviews.Content: me and my boyfriend were very satisfied with Maikol accommodation. Very nice and helpful staff, clean and spacious room. quite place, close to the centre and a great price. We can recommend this place!!!! definitely! By the way, breakfast, which was brought to our room, was a very nice surprise! Thank you Maikol L + M ( Czech Rep)

Reviews.Title: “Good budget option”
Reviews.Author: TravelProFL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Maikol for one night. We picked this B&B b/c of its close proximity to Termini train station and the price was right. Come to find out it was not as easy to get to as we thought after having to cross busy intersections and drag our suitcases on cobblestone sidewalks in the rain. If you plan to walk, it's best to go towards the southeast end of Termini before exiting onto Giovanni Giolitti and head south on Via Mamiani. We usually walk everywhere we go but in this case, having luggage and a toddler to worry about, a cab ride is the way to go - just 5mins and costs 5EUR plus about 3EUR luggage fee...well worth it! Pay attention to the pictures posted on here that included a picture of the entrance and the shops below. This helped us tremendously to locate the B&B. After ging through a gauntlet of two solid, high security doors, you take the elevator up just to come down a few spiral steps to get to the hotel. Seems a bit strange and awkward but not too big of a hassle except for a couple of tight corners and clever maneuvers with our luggage. We were greeted by friendly staff in a very simple and basic reception area. Staff was pleasant, spoke understandable English, and was accommodating with our early morning 6:45am breakfast delivery request. Room was very basic. Good views of the park across the street. The teeniest TV I have ever seen in a hotel room. Their A/C, heat, or phone were not working eventhough they were provided. They offer wireless internet only. Pretty much your standard 2-3 star clean and friendly mom and pop accommodation. Fits the budget for 1 or 2 nights but not something I'd recommend for anything more especcially for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly reception and nice, big room”
Reviews.Author: etjoyce
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to be close to Termini before an early flight. It was a pleasant surprise. We had a bit of trouble finding it at first but if you just go to the Victorio Emmanuelle piazza, it's on the square and actually easy to locate. It's one minute from a metro stop (Red line). The reception was so friendly. We were on our way out of Rome, but we heard her give an enthusiastic and warm orientation/ city welcome to another set of guests. Our room was huge in comparison to other hotels we've stayed in. Also very clean. Good bathroom. Honestly, it was a great hotel. Not the loveliest of areas but totally safe and accessible if you want to walk a bit or just hop on the metro. Unfortunately, we left too early to try the breakfast but apparently it's quite good. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great B&B in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Mayathedog
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Maikol. The room was a good size and overlooked the park across the street. The service was top-notch and friendly. The room service breakfast made for a nice start to the day, and it was a very nice breakfast. Betty, the owner, was very friendly and helpful in suggesting where to go and how to get there (it was our first time in Rome). It is located about 4 blocks from the Termini train station, so an easy walk. The area in which the Maikol is located is a little different, but within easy walking to the Colosseum and the downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but tidier and better service than a lot of other places”
Reviews.Author: melfin74
Reviews.Content: We were only staying one night in Rome and found this close to Termini and good access to the Metro. It was a bit hard to find as we were looking for the doors on the wrong part of the square, but did find it. We were early but were able to use the facilities and get changed and leave our bags there. Arrived back later that evening and the bags had been moved to the room for us. The room is basic but has everything you need really, including air con, and the free sweets were great. Liked the room service approach to breakfast. Couldn't fault it - Rome accommodation is generally expensive and this was cheap in comparison to most and although it was basic the room looked like new and the bathroom was mould free.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need for that Rome Experience”
Reviews.Author: IrelandRaffo
Reviews.Content: I went to Rome with a few friends during August this year for 5 days and stayed in Hotel Maikol,have to admit at first sight I thought oh no what have we let ourselves in for. ..how wrong I was!! Granted it doesnt look like much from outside just your basic roman wooden doors, once you get in to the hotel which takes its security very seriously, which is a bonus, the place looks amazin. It has this gorgeous spiral staircase that seems to go on forever (although there is a lift for those who dont fancy climbing) and every time you enter you are always greeted with the big smile from Betty the owner of Hotel Maikol.This hotel is everything you need for a basic but comfortable few days in rome the hospitality is amazing and nothing is ever to much to ask for were Betty and her family are concerned. The rooms are immaculate cleaned every day with fresh towels every morning and also have air con which is a neccessity in Rome during August and then of course there is the lovely traditional roman breakfast which is brought to your room every morning without a doubt. Overall I personally thought that this Hotel captured the relaxed, authentic feel of Rome and just added to the experience and again the hospitality is heartwarming! Will definately be back to rome and will definatly be staying there again!!

Reviews.Title: “the best your money can buy”
Reviews.Author: moticless
Reviews.Content: Maikol is a lovely quite place in not-so-nice neighborhood. Yet it is close to Termini and the Metro which is a great thing. At the hotel you feel very safe as you get 4 keys to open your way from the main entrance up to your room. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. It is rather cheap compare to the prices you pay at Rome elsewhere. Elizabeth, the owner, and her family runs the business are very kind and willing to help. The breakfast composed from yogurt+bread+cake+jam+coffee. It was fine for me but my wife preferred something more healthy.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome--Perfect place to experience Rome on a budget.”
Reviews.Author: 777trojan
Reviews.Content: Maikol was a great! We arrived late at night and found the hotel with no really problems. It is located exactly as everyone said: through the big wood doors, then through the door on the right and up to the second (American third) floor. First the location was perfect for getting around. It is in walking distance to the Coliseum and many churches, etc. It is also within walking distance to the main train station in Rome. Beyond that, the subway stop is steps from the front door. From the subway you can get all the way to St. Peter's and everything in between. We didn't think the hotel was in a bad neighborhood at all. It's in a typically neighborhood for Rome.
