We never felt that we were in any danger. There is always someone at the desk upstairs so if your key doesn't work at the many doors you can always buzz in. The hotel is very secure. Lastly, and most importantly, the lady who runs the place is amazing. She is incredibly nice and gave us advice on how to get around. She also would bring us breakfast each morning. Even when we were going to leave early, she went and whipped up the breakfast before we left. We highly recommend this place to anyone who wants a great place for a reasonable price. I really don't see any reason to go to a chain hotel when Maikol offers everything they have and more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: tomanddebbie
Reviews.Content: Clean, Convenient, Comfortable. Decent Value. A little hard to find, needs a real sign. Around the corner from the MAS Store main entrance. I enjoyed the Buzz of the city life

Reviews.Title: “darling home-like hotel”
Reviews.Author: rosilox
Reviews.Content: Elizabeth is so warm and friendly! The hotel can be hard to find since it's through large double doors off the main plaza but the hospitality is excellent. The largest room we had on this trip and an amazing breakfast each day - including giant pitchers of hot espresso for making cappucino/etc. It's a great home base for exploring Rome in fact the Coloseum is about a 20 minute walk. Also, in June the public park across the street screens movies at night...and don't neglect the very affordable cheeses and salumi at SMA (market) down the street. Perfect for an in room picnic!

Reviews.Title: “Believe the hype!”
Reviews.Author: skam
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the positive comments that i've read. The only thing I'd add is make sure you check out the MAS store that is next door to the hotel main entrance. The store (which is on several floors) has everything you'll need for a stay in Rome and at very cheap prices. San Lorenzo is about 10minutes walk away if you go through the tunnel that goes under the Termini railway line. San Lorenzo is a must visit if you want great food and wine at a third of the price to central Rome. Also the Metro line A is 30seconds walk away and is a must use on those hot Rome days.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place, wonderful people and great value”
Reviews.Author: djspanna
Reviews.Content: Spotless and so clean, really nice location as well near to Metro stop. Owners cannot do enough for you and are extremely friendly so I would recommend 100% Also its such great value for a nice big central spotlessly clean room in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel on a budget”
Reviews.Author: BeachBum_24x7
Reviews.Content: Hotel Maikol was our last stop in a 3 week vacation in Italy. The location is conveniently located just steps away from the Metro station and within walking distance to the train station as well. The rooms were big and clean, but the staff and their service was what made this hotel stand out from the rest. The family operated hotel does not have a grand entrance. All you'll see is a apartment door where you would buzz in to enter the building. To find the hotel, you will have to look for the exact address as there is no big sign for it. Once inside, the family staff treats each guest with the utmost courtesy and respect. They are extremely friendly and delivers excellent breakfast each morning to your room. On top of that, this hotel had the cheapest deal we could find all over Italy, and it far exceeded our expectations. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great budget option: clean and hospitable”
Reviews.Author: dsale
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed our stay at Maikol. I will say that due to some reviews on the site, I was very worried about this hotel. When we first arrived, I agree that the location appears a little unsafe, but later in our stay, we were completely comfortable. Additionally, buzzing into the building was a bit inconvenient, but it helped us feel really safe. The room was sufficient space, and was very clean. We enjoyed the breakfast, which included hot drinks, juice, yogurt, and fresh croissants. It is served in your room, and one morning we told them that we would be leaving before 7 am for a day trip, and they agreed to serve breakfast early for us. I would definitely recommend this hotel, but remember that it is a budget option. *Also, they did not provide washcloths; luckily we brought our own.*

Reviews.Title: “nice & satisfying”
Reviews.Author: atugruls
Reviews.Content: the most satisfying thing about maikol should be the price/quality ratio as this hotel (or B&B to be more precise) is not exceling in any certain field but overall providing a very decent service for a very reasonable price. assuming that many of readers already read the previous comments, i will focus on the most praised or complained parts. the staff yes definetely the staff is very hospitable and kind. they try to provide you with everything you request. (once i asked for wireless router password for surfing with my mobile phone, instead she gave her laptop to me for use in the room - without any charge). but a negative note; they dont have much idea about what is currently going on in rome and they are not very knowledgeable about touristic sites. breakfast in room frankly, i did not understand the hype about breakfast being served within the room. it only consists of croissants and couple of packed jams. And what about everything being sweet ? ( i mean sugary) nothing salty offered in breakfast, no cheese, no olives etc. everything was sugary including the croissants. we had to bought some cheese from a local store for having a descent breakfast. location it is close to termini station, but if you have heavy luggage i recommend you to take the metro. the stop is only 20-30 m from the hotel. but pay attention to take the correct exit out of metro or you can end up on the other end of the piazza, which means a bit longer walk. you need to take either bus or metro for every major touristic attraction, i suggest even for colesseum eventhough it looks very close on the map.(you will be exhausted in the queue at the entrance to coleseum anyway, so dont spend unnecessary energy on the way) neighborhood looks a bit scary at first, but we had no security issues at all, not even glares. overall this hotel is what you paid for, nothing more nothing less.this is not smth to be underestimated, gives you a considerable peace of mind.

Reviews.Title: “Budget travelers only!”
Reviews.Author: juliagulia24
Reviews.Content: We chose this place because it was close to the Metro/train station since we needed to leave for the airport early in the morning and were only going to be there a day and 1/2. Make no mistake - The location is sketchy. Think, Rome meets China Town & Harlem. However, coming from a city, it was not unstayable so to speak. The amenities are simple, Read: You get what you pay for. The room though was clean and the family that runs it very nice people plus free breakfast. Also know - You have to buzz in everytime you come to the hotel - They don't have a curfew, but it was annoying. The plus: It was indeed right near the metro which was nice for getting to places off metro lines. Other than that, do not expect much.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, friendly, very convenient to central train station”
Reviews.Author: phalen19
Reviews.Content: Small bed and breakfast very near central train station. My husband and I booked this for one night before we flew out of Rome. The family lives on the premises. The room was not lavish but very clean, comfortable, good shower, and roomy enough for our purposes. The owner offered to bring our breakfast to the room at 5:45 am so we could catch our train to the airport. Breakfast was very nice-capucchino, tea, croissants and jelly, yogurt, and orange juice. The train station was 10 minutes walk with our several suitcases. The air-conditioning was great on a very hot day in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and value for money”
Reviews.Author: werribeelad
Reviews.Content: At 80Euros/night, we found the MAIKOL great value for money. Betty, the host, was terrific as was the breakfast and overall service. A little hard to find at first (Just push open the big wooden doors off street level, go to the first door on the right and push the intercom button labelled MAIKOL) Once in, we found it secure, clean and in an ideal location to see the sights of Rome either by foot or by the Metro. We had no problems walking to and from the MAIKOL at day or night. Thanks to Betty for a hassle free stay.

Reviews.Title: “Super nice, great location!”
Reviews.Author: AdeleLa
Reviews.Content: Very friendly service and a great breakfast served to your room. Very clean place and the rooms are large. Great location right next to the Metro stop and walking distance to the Termini. Colosseum area in 10-15 minutes walking distance. Difficult to find the right door, but thanks to the Tripadvisor we knew it beforehand. Ringing the 2 doorbells allwys before entranece is sometimes a little bit annoying. Piazza Vittorio Emanuele II is a little bit "un-tidy" but you don't need to go there :) A nice, cheap Supermarket on Via Guicciardini (if I remember this right) in about 5-7 minutes walk . There you can find prosciutto, antipasti, (both vacuum packed) Grappa etc to take home in a reasonable price (3 times cheaper than on the airport). Great small Trattoria Monti just next to the hotel (make a reservation!)

Reviews.Title: “Good value, next to subway, shady but kinda safe looking area”
Reviews.Author: pathkid
Reviews.Content: Pros: great value, 99 euros/night as of 6/09 through venere.com, clean, speak english, they bring breakfast to your room!, really nice owners/keepers, they accept credit card. Cons: kinda seedy location, gotta buzz in everytime, they dont give u your key so u gotta ring the bell ALL the time wihen u exit and enter. They hold onto your room key...made me a bit paranoid. Ok, we booked through venere.com cuz it offered the cheapest price. They take mastercard, great! The room was super clean and spacious. The keepers are really nice and speak english. The breakfast was great!, warm bread, good yogurt and coffee, and they give it to you in your room. The overall value is superb I think for Rome. 99Euros a night is a very reasonable, I would certaqin ly recommend this place again to anyone. BUT BUT the location is kinda seedy...kinda. It's located 100 ft from the subway station and right below is some flea market thing and discount store, with all those weird gypsy ppl. The area I think is an ethnic neighborhood too, whcih may bother some. I'm not say that's bad, but imagine staying in a nice B&B with great clean rooms and owners...but it's located in china town NYC...safe but kinda dirty and seedy. During the day, the location is really busy with shops, but man after 8pm...it dies. NO one is around, kinda spooky and a sense of being unsafe, but hey, i'm a little paranoid. So, a great place to stay with some friends and yonger type couples. But not really the best for that young family with toddlers and that 90 year old grandmother. Overall i do recommend this place, it's real. The good remarks are real. It's thumbs up. Pictures included.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL, GOOD LOCATION, NICEST STAFF!!!”
Reviews.Author: Keiko54
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. It is run by a family who are all super sweet and helpful. The hotel is a little hard to find but right next to a train stop. It is very clean and the rooms are very large.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the budget traveler who needs to be near the train station.”
Reviews.Author: 2009Traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in May because we needed to be near the train station and the Maikol had good reviews for a good price. We had spent 3 days in Rome then 4 days in Florence, and took the train back in to Rome from Florence for our one final day in Rome before our return trip home. We then took the Leonardo Express train from Termini to the airport in the morning. The hotel is on the Piazza Vittorio Emanuele, which has a metro station. It is not far from the Termini train station but we ended up taking the metro from the hotel to the Termini when we left because it is probably about a 6 or 7 block walk from the entrace to Termini, which is kind of a pain even with small rolling suitcases. The area surrounding Termini and the Piazza Vittorio Emanuele is a bit seedy. Next time I would just stay near a metro but would not try to be near Termini. The hotel (which is really a bed and breakfast) is very difficult to find. We walked around the entire square before we finally located it. You have to press a buzzer to get into the courtyard, then another buzzer to get to the elevator, then someone has to let you in to the front door of the B&B. This is fine but if you want to do a lot of coming and going, it's a bit awkward, especially if you are out late at night. Our room was adequate for our needs. It had an air conditioner, but if you use the air conditioner you have to close the windows, which are like shutters and which therefore block out all natural light when closed. The overhead lights were fluorescent, which I find a little depressing. There are no common areas, so a breakfast of cappuccinos and sugary croissants is brought to your room at the hour you request. For one night, the price was right, but next time I would stay somewhere in a nicer location and would prefer a traditional hotel where you don't have to pass through locked three doors before reaching the door to your room.

Reviews.Title: “If you look for a B&B for one night close to Termini railway station, Maikol is perfect.”
Reviews.Author: mi1972
Reviews.Content: Maikol really is a mixed bag: Once, it is hard to find. Then, based on their website, you expect some sort of hotel, but instead you wind yourself through staircases (or an elevator) into a residential building. The first feel is a bit like in a dorm. Next, the great hosts -- the team is really friendly. My room was nice and freshly renovated, and crisply clean and looked into an inner courtyard (good air, no noise at all). Breakfast was great. There is one drawback though: They have no breakfast room. Eating in your bed is ok for me for one day, but had I stayed there longer, the "dorm feel" of _having to_ eat in my bed would have annoyed me. To sum it up: A perfect place for one night, not sure if I want to stay there for a week. And: make sure you get a room for 80 EUR, I paid more than 100 and that was a bit too much...

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: SCStew
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I really enjoyed our recent 6 day stay at the Hotel Maikol. The family run hotel was clean with spacious and bright rooms and a great breakfast served right in our room. The owner greeted us each time we returned from our daily activities and asked if there was anything we needed. All the family members were so friendly and welcoming. The location was great. What a perfect place to stay!! We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THIS PLACE- GOOD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: gordoncastle88
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a good hotel in Rome then I would reccomend this Hotel. The staff were very helpfull, especially as I dont speak very good Italian, and were there to answer any questions. Rome is a great place to visit and would stay again at this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean hotel with super-nice staff”
Reviews.Author: michapok
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Maikol in early May 2009 for a sightseeing trip around Rome (three nights). The rooms were very clean, big and the breakfast was basic but filling. The hotel overlooks a large square, but is surprisingly quiet. Our only little complaint was that it is kind of hard to find since there are zero signs outside saying there's a hotel there. Basically it's behind a large wooden door that's sandwiched between two shops. You have to get buzzed in (there are also apartments that share the space), then go up the elevator to the hotel. Once you get it once it's easy. If you want to walk from the train station to the hotel it's about 10-15 minutes away. Otherwise the subway is right at the hotel's doorstep (make sure you get out at the correct exit once you're at the Vittorio Emanuele stop!)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location good, hard to find.”
Reviews.Author: Traveller-girl2-UK
Reviews.Content: We arrived at night time to Piazza Vittorio Emanuele we could not find the hotel entrance as it is concealed, however Betty (the owner) was fantastic and came down to meet us after i rang to say we got lost. This was the only point. The rooms are very clean and the breakfast is good. We felt safe in the hotel (mainly due to great security to get into it and the warmth of the owner) and i am normally quite hard to please!! The view was nice too. There is a fridge/mini bar in the room. Overall good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleseant stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: rubrav
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife wanted a room with breakfast near centrum of Rome. The room was very new, clean and well prepered. The owner(?) was very friendly and helpful. The only negative thing was that there were table and dining cheers,- but no problem with eating the breakfast in the bed! I hope to come back!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Maikol Rome
HotelInfo.Address: Piazza Vittorio Emanuele II, 138, 00185 Rome, Italy
